      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">P</font><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ROXY</font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">
S</font><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">TATEMENT</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">AND</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">2009 A</font><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">NNUAL</font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">
R</font><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">EPORT</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">________</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center">&#160;</div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center">&#160;</div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center">&#160;</div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center">&#160;</div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center"><img src="kroger_pre14a1x1x1.jpg" alt="">&#160;</div>
      <div align="center">&#160;</div>
      <div align="center">&#160;</div>
    </div><br>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="center"><img src="kroger_pre14a1x2x1.jpg" alt=""></div>
    </div><br>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">F</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ELLOW</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> S</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">HAREHOLDERS</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">:</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The Kroger team delivered solid results in
2009. In doing so, we further strengthened our competitive position &#8211; improving
our unique advantage in the marketplace by continuing to successfully execute
our Customer 1<font style="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top">st</font>
business strategy in one of the most challenging retail environments in recent
history.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>As a Shareholder of Kroger, you
should know that our Customers always come first. This philosophy drives our
focus on programs that help loyal Customers get even more value as they shop
more frequently in our stores. This Customer-centric approach also drives the
increase in the total number of loyal Customers we serve.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">2009
Highlights</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>We generated an increase in total
sales to $76.7 billion and reported net earnings of $70 million or $0.11 per
diluted share. Excluding the effect of a non-cash impairment charge taken in the
third quarter for southern California assets, the net earnings for fiscal 2009
would have been $1.12 billion or $1.71 per diluted share.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>Even in the face of high
unemployment, unprecedented deflation, and a weak U.S. economy, Kroger improved
its operational performance and continued to focus on creating value for our
Shareholders. We did this by:</font></div>
      <ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Increasing revenue from loyal
  households;<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Generating strong tonnage
  growth;<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Growing identical
  sales;<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Investing in our stores to keep
  them fresh and inviting;<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Increasing market
  share;<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Returning more than $450 million
  to our Shareholders; and<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Listening to our Customers and
  Associates.</font> </li>
      </ul>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">We are increasing revenue from loyal
households.</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>By offering a unique and
personalized value proposition for our diverse shoppers, we increased the number
of households that are loyal to Kroger and earned a greater share of their
business. These loyal households represent our very best Customers.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>Kroger&#8217;s unique offerings include
rewarding Customers for their loyalty in multiple ways, tailoring offers that
are meaningful to their individual households through the use of our robust
shopper loyalty data, and delighting them with a pleasant and convenient
shopping experience.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">We are generating strong tonnage
growth.</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>Strong growth in sales of our
Corporate Brands along with national brand items is driving the most dramatic
tonnage growth in Kroger&#8217;s history. Our strong volume growth is a direct result
of our investments in pricing, service and product offering and is among the
strongest in the industry in both perishable and non-perishable categories. Our
associates in our plants, warehouses and stores are doing an outstanding job
keeping up with the tremendous volume growth we are generating.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">1</font></font></div>
    </div><br>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">We are growing identical
sales.</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Throughout 2009, Kroger successfully grew
identical sales, one of the key objectives of our business model. Identical
supermarket sales increased 2.1%, without fuel, compared with the prior year.
Through the efforts of all of our Associates, we continue to widen the gap
between Kroger&#8217;s identical sales growth trends and those of most of our
competitors. We believe this trend has extremely positive implications for our
Associates, Customers and Shareholders both now and as we continue to grow our
business.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">We continue to invest in our stores
to keep them fresh and inviting for Customers.</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>Our remodeled stores continue to
generate favorable returns and we plan to continue on our steady course of
remodeling stores and other assets to keep them innovative and appealing to our
Customers. These projects enhance the overall shopping experience for our
Customers, improve the work environment for our Associates, and help drive
sales. Remodels also enable us to utilize more efficient technology, which
creates cost savings we can invest in our strategy.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">We are increasing Kroger&#8217;s market
share.</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>Growing market share is an important
part of Kroger&#8217;s long-term strategy. In 2009, Kroger&#8217;s overall market share
increased approximately 60 basis points, according to Nielsen Homescan Data.
Kroger&#8217;s market share increased in 13 of the 17 marketing areas outlined by the
Nielsen report, declined in three, and remained unchanged in one.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">We are rewarding our
Shareholders.</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>In 2009, we returned more than $450
million to our Shareholders through our dividend program and share repurchases.
We increased our quarterly dividend in 2009 by more than 5% per share in a year
when many large companies reduced or eliminated dividends. This marked the third
increase in the quarterly dividend since the program was initiated in 2006. In
2009, Kroger paid $237.6 million in cash dividends. Kroger&#8217;s dividend enhances
total shareholder return by more than 1.5% on an annual basis. During the year,
Kroger repurchased 10.3 million shares of stock at an average price of $21.25
per share for a total investment of $218.3 million.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">We listen to our Customers and
Associates.</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>Every quarter, we track what our
Customers say about us in four key areas: our people, our prices, our products,
and the overall shopping experience in our stores. Their feedback helps us offer
a better overall shopping experience. It includes clean stores with quick
checkout lines; well-trained, friendly Associates; and a relevant assortment of
products that offer more value for the way our Customers live.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>In 2009, our Customers told us we
improved more in each of our key Customer 1<font style="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top">st</font> areas than in any
year since we began these Customer surveys in 2004. We saw a good balance of
improvement across all four keys. These surveys provide meaningful insight we
can act on immediately. We will continue to seek feedback from our Customers and
incorporate what they tell us into the way we manage our business. We conduct
similar surveys of our Associates and continue to make improvements based on
what our Associates tell us is important to them. Associate engagement is a
critical part of our Customer 1<font style="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top">st</font>
strategy.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">2</font></font></div>
    </div><br>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">We are committed to
safety.</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Safety is a core value at Kroger. As a result
of our deeply engaging safety programs, we have reduced our accident rates in
our stores and plants by 72% over the past 14 years. We continue to strive to
achieve our goal of zero accidents.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">We partner with our Customers and
Associates to support the communities we serve.</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>We touch the lives of millions of
Customers every day through our family of stores. We consider it a privilege to
partner with our Customers and Associates to improve the communities we serve.
We focus our efforts on hunger relief, local community organizations, especially
K-12 schools, and women&#8217;s health initiatives. In 2009, our family of stores, the
Kroger Foundation, and our Associates and Customers donated more than $150
million to support organizations and causes that are important to
them.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>Every year, Kroger proudly
recognizes some of the many Associates who make outstanding contributions to
their communities. The winners of The Kroger Co. Community Service Award for
2009 are listed following this letter.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>We are proud of what our Associates
accomplished throughout the year and we look forward to building on this
momentum.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">We continue to make strong progress
on our Sustainability agenda.</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>At Kroger, we have four focus areas
for Sustainability:</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; ">
<tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;1)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></td>
            <td width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Using energy more
      efficiently, which reduces our carbon footprint;</font></td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td colspan="2">&#160;</td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;2)</font></td>
            <td width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Recycling and
      reducing waste, including plastic bags and waste generated in our
      stores;</font></td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td colspan="2">&#160;</td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;3)</font></td>
            <td width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Reducing the
      effects of our supply chain;</font></td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td colspan="2">&#160;</td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;4)</font></td>
            <td width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Enabling our
      Customers and Associates to improve their own communities and take
      meaningful steps to protect the environment.</font></td>
          </tr></table>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>In 2009, we continued our aggressive
program to reduce energy usage in our stores and plants. In the past 10 years,
Kroger has reduced its energy consumption by more than 27%. This year, we
installed LED lighting and energy-efficient motors in freezer cases in many of
our stores.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>We are off to a good start toward
our waste reduction goal of saving 1 billion plastic bags. Our Associates are
helping us achieve this goal by increasing the number of items placed in each
bag while still meeting the needs of Customers. At the same time, our Customers
are using more reusable bags for their shopping trips. Every reusable bag has
the potential to save 1,000 plastic bags over its lifetime.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>Our fleet efficiency improved by
more than 7% in 2009, meaning our Logistics team delivered more cases of
products per gallon of fuel used.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>As Customer interest in buying
locally grown products has increased, we have standardized programs to make it
easier for our stores to source fresh products from local farmers and small
businesses, reducing transportation and minimizing handling.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">3</font></font></div>
    </div><br>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">We are confronting our
challenges.</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">As we look ahead, the slow pace of the
economic recovery will continue to influence Kroger&#8217;s business in fiscal 2010.
Unemployment levels remain high, suppressing consumer confidence and spending.
Volatility in inflation or deflation and changes in the competitive landscape
will continue to affect our business in the coming year. Significant increases
in health care and pension costs, as well as credit card fees, will also affect
our business. We will address these challenges, and others, as we continue to
grow our business over the long term.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>Kroger stands apart from others in
our industry because of our Customer 1<font style="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top">st</font> strategy and our
Associates&#8217; commitment to making it a reality every day for every Customer who
visits one of our stores.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>We believe Kroger will continue to
be in the best position to deliver Shareholder value now and as the economy and
consumer confidence improve.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>On behalf of the entire Kroger team,
thank you for your continued trust and support.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div><img src="kroger_pre14a1x6x1.jpg" alt=""> <br><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">David B. Dillon<br></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Chairman of the Board and<br>Chief Executive
Officer</font>

      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">4</font></font></div>
    </div><br>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">

    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">N</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OTICE</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OF</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> A</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">NNUAL</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> M</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">EETING</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inlin
e; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OF</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> S</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">HAREHOLDERS</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="right"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Cincinnati, Ohio, May
14, 2010</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">To All Shareholders
of The Kroger Co.:</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The annual meeting of shareholders of The
Kroger Co. will be held at the DUKE ENERGY CONVENTION CENTER, Junior Ballroom,
3<font style="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top">rd</font> Floor, 525 Elm
Street, Cincinnati, Ohio 45202, on June 24, 2010, at 11 a.m., eastern time, for
the following purposes:</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; ">
<tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;1.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></td>
            <td width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">To elect the
      directors for the ensuing year;</font></td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td colspan="2">&#160;</td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;2.</font></td>
            <td width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">To consider and
      act upon a proposal to adopt an amendment to the Company&#8217;s Amended
      Articles of Incorporation;</font></td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td colspan="2">&#160;</td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;3.</font></td>
            <td width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">To consider and
      act upon a proposal to ratify the selection of independent auditors for
      the year 2010;</font></td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td colspan="2">&#160;</td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;4.</font></td>
            <td width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">To act upon a
      shareholder proposal, if properly presented at the annual meeting;
      and</font></td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td colspan="2">&#160;</td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;5.</font></td>
            <td width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">To transact such
      other business as may properly be brought before the
  meeting;</font></td>
          </tr></table>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">all as set forth in the Proxy
Statement accompanying this Notice. Holders of common shares of record at the
close of business on April 26, 2010 will be entitled to vote at the
meeting.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">A</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">TTENDANCE</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Only shareholders and persons holding proxies
from shareholders may attend the meeting. </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Please bring to the meeting the notice of the meeting or the&#160;top
portion of your proxy card that was mailed to you as this will serve as your
admission ticket. <font style="FONT-WEIGHT: normal">Several parking areas are
located in close proximity to the Duke Energy Convention Center, including the
Sixth Street Parking Garage that connects to the Convention Center via the
Skywalk.</font></font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>YOUR MANAGEMENT DESIRES TO HAVE A
LARGE NUMBER OF SHAREHOLDERS REPRESENTED AT THE MEETING, IN PERSON OR BY PROXY.
PLEASE VOTE YOUR PROXY ELECTRONICALLY VIA THE INTERNET OR BY TELEPHONE. IF YOU
HAVE ELECTED TO RECEIVE PRINTED MATERIALS, YOU MAY SIGN AND DATE THE PROXY AND
MAIL IT IN THE SELF-ADDRESSED ENVELOPE PROVIDED. NO POSTAGE IS REQUIRED IF
MAILED WITHIN THE UNITED STATES.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>If you are unable to attend the
annual meeting, you may listen to a live webcast of the meeting, which will be
accessible through our website, www.thekrogerco.com, at 11 a.m., eastern
time.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>

      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">6</font></font></div>
    </div><br>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">P</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ROXY</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> S</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">TATEMENT</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="right"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Cincinnati, Ohio, May
14, 2010</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Your proxy is solicited by the Board of
Directors of The Kroger Co., and the cost of solicitation will be borne by
Kroger. We will reimburse banks, brokers, nominees, and other fiduciaries for
postage and reasonable expenses incurred by them in forwarding the proxy
material to their principals. Kroger has retained D.F. King &amp; Co., Inc., 48
Wall Street, New York, New York, to assist in the solicitation of proxies and
will pay that firm a fee estimated at present not to exceed $15,000. Proxies may
be solicited personally, by telephone, electronically via the Internet, or by
mail.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>David B. Dillon, John T. LaMacchia,
and Bobby S. Shackouls, all of whom are Kroger directors, have been named
members of the Proxy Committee.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>The principal executive offices of
The Kroger Co. are located at 1014 Vine Street, Cincinnati, Ohio 45202-1100. Our
telephone number is 513-762-4000. This Proxy Statement and Annual Report, and
the accompanying proxy, were first furnished to shareholders on May 14,
2010.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>As of the close of business on April
26, 2010, our outstanding voting securities consisted of 644,849,993 shares of
common stock, the holders of which will be entitled to one vote per share at the
annual meeting. The shares represented by each proxy will be voted unless the
proxy is revoked before it is exercised. Revocation may be in writing to
Kroger&#8217;s Secretary, or in person at the meeting, or by appointment of a
subsequent proxy. Shareholders may not cumulate votes in the election of
directors.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>The effect of broker non-votes and
abstentions on matters presented for shareholder vote is as
follows:</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Item No. 1, Election of
Directors</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> &#8211; The election
of directors is determined by plurality. Broker non-votes and abstentions will
have no effect on this proposal.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Item No. 2, Amendment to Amended
Articles of Incorporation</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">
&#8211; The affirmative vote representing a majority of the outstanding common shares
is required to amend Kroger&#8217;s Amended Articles of Incorporation as set forth in
this Proxy Statement. Accordingly, broker non-votes and abstentions will have
the same effect as votes against this proposal.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Item No. 3, Selection of
Auditors</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> &#8211; Ratification by
shareholders of the selection of auditors requires the affirmative vote of the
majority of shares participating in the voting. Accordingly, abstentions will
have no effect on this proposal.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Item No. 4, Shareholder
Proposal</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> &#8211; The affirmative
vote of a majority of shares participating in the voting on a shareholder
proposal is required for its adoption. Proxies will be voted AGAINST this
proposal unless the Proxy Committee is otherwise instructed on a proxy properly
executed and returned. Abstentions and broker non-votes will have no effect on
this proposal.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">7</font></font></div>
    </div><br>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">P</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ROPOSALS</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">TO</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> S</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">HAREHOLDERS</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">E</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">LECTION</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OF</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> D</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">IRECTORS</font></font></div>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">(I</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">TEM</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> N</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">O</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">. 1)</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The Board of Directors, as now authorized,
consists of fourteen members. All members are to be elected at the annual
meeting to serve until the annual meeting in 2011, or until their successors
have been elected by the shareholders or by the Board of Directors pursuant to
Kroger&#8217;s Regulations, and qualified. Candidates for director receiving the
greatest number of votes cast by holders of shares entitled to vote at a meeting
at which a quorum is present are elected, up to the maximum number of directors
to be chosen at the meeting. Pursuant to guidelines adopted by the Board, in an
uncontested election where cumulative voting is not in effect, any nominee who
receives a greater number of votes &#8220;withheld&#8221; from his or her election than
votes &#8220;for&#8221; such election promptly will tender his or her resignation following
certification of the shareholder vote. The Corporate Governance Committee of our
Board of Directors will consider the resignation offer and recommend to the
Board whether to accept the resignation.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>The experience, qualifications,
attributes, and skills that led the Corporate Governance Committee and the Board
to conclude that the following individuals should serve as directors are set
forth opposite each individual&#8217;s name. The committee memberships stated below
are those in effect as of the date of this proxy statement. It is intended that,
except to the extent that authority is withheld, proxies will be voted for the
election of the following persons:</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>

              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Reuben V. Anderson</font></font></div>

            <td valign="top" width="1%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">&#160;</td>
            <td valign="top" width="72%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">
              <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Mr. Anderson is
      a Senior Partner in the Jackson, Mississippi office of Phelps Dunbar, a
      regional law firm based in New Orleans. Prior to joining this law firm, he
      was a justice of the Supreme Court of Mississippi. Mr. Anderson is a
      director of AT&amp;T Inc., and during the past five years was a director
      of AT&amp;T Inc., BellSouth Corporation, Burlington Resources Inc., and
      Trustmark Corporation. He is a member of the Corporate Governance and
      Public Responsibilities Committees.</font></div>
              <div>&#160;</div>
              <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Mr. Anderson
      has extensive litigation experience, and he served as the first
      African-American Justice on the Mississippi Supreme Court. His knowledge
      and judgment gained through years of legal practice are of great value to
      the Board. In addition, as former Chairman of the Board of Trustees of
      Tougaloo College and a resident of Mississippi, he brings to the Board his
      insights into the African-American community and the southern region of
      the United States. Mr. Anderson has served on numerous board committees,
      including audit, public policy, finance, executive, and nominating
      committees.</font></div>

              <div>&#160;</div>
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="1%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">&#160;</td>
            <td valign="top" width="72%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">
              <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Mr. Beyer is
      Chairman of Chaparal Investments LLC, a private investment firm and
      holding company that he founded in 2009. From 2005 to 2009, Mr. Beyer
      served as Chief Executive Officer of The TCW Group, Inc., a global
      investment management firm. From 2000 to 2005, he served as President and
      Chief Investment Officer of Trust Company of the West, the principal
      operating subsidiary of TCW. Mr. Beyer is a member of the Board of
      Directors of The Allstate Corporation, and in the past five years was a
      director of The TCW Group, Inc. and its parent, Soci&#233;t&#233; G&#233;n&#233;rale Asset
      Management, S.A. He is chair of the Financial Policy Committee and a
      member of the Compensation Committee.</font></div>
              <div>&#160;</div>
              <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Mr. Beyer
      brings to Kroger his experience as CEO of TCW, a global investment
      management firm serving many of the largest institutional investors in the
      U.S. He has exceptional insight into Kroger&#8217;s financial strategy, and his
      experience qualifies him to chair the Financial Policy Committee. While at
      TCW, he also conceived and developed the firm&#8217;s risk management
      infrastructure, an experience that is useful to the Kroger Board in
      performing its risk management oversight functions. His experience in
      managing compensation programs makes him a valued member of the
      Compensation Committee. His abilities and service as a director were
      recognized by his peers, who selected Mr. Beyer as an Outstanding Director
      in 2008 as part of the Outstanding Directors Program of the </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Financial Times</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">.</font></div>
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="1%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">&#160;</td>

              <div>&#160;</div>
            </td>

            <td valign="top" width="72%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">
              <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Mr. Dillon was
      elected Chairman of the Board of Kroger in 2004, Chief Executive Officer
      in 2003, and President and Chief Operating Officer in 2000. He served as
      President in 1999, and as President and Chief Operating Officer from 1995
      to 1999. Mr. Dillon was elected Executive Vice President of Kroger in 1990
      and President of Dillon Companies, Inc. in 1986. He is a director of
      Convergys Corporation, and has served on that board during the past five
      years.</font></div>
              <div>&#160;</div>
              <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Mr. Dillon
      brings to Kroger his extensive knowledge of the supermarket business,
      having over 30 years of experience with Kroger and Dillon Companies. In
      addition to his depth of knowledge of Kroger and the fiercely competitive
      industry in which Kroger operates, he has gained a wealth of experience by
      serving on compensation and governance committees of another
      board.</font></div>

      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">9</font></font></div>
    </div><br>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="LINE-HEIGHT: 14pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; ">
<tr valign="bottom">
            <td nowrap width="20%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            </td>
            <td nowrap width="1%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            </td>
            <td nowrap width="72%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Professional</font></font></td>
            <td nowrap width="1%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            </td>
            <td nowrap width="2%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            </td>
            <td nowrap width="1%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            </td>
            <td nowrap width="3%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Director</font></font></td>
          </tr><tr valign="bottom">
            <td nowrap width="20%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Name</font></font></td>
            <td nowrap width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</td>
            <td nowrap width="72%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Occupation (1)</font></font></td>
            <td nowrap width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</td>
            <td nowrap width="2%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Age</font></font></td>
            <td nowrap width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</td>
            <td nowrap width="3%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Since</font></font></td>
          </tr><tr style="LINE-HEIGHT: normal;">
            <td align="left" nowrap valign="top" width="20%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">
              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Susan J. Kropf</font></font></div>
              <div>&#160;</div>
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="1%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">&#160;</td>
            <td valign="top" width="72%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">
              <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Ms. Kropf was
      President and Chief Operating Officer of Avon Products Inc., a
      manufacturer and marketer of beauty care products, from 2001 until her
      retirement in January 2007. She joined Avon in 1970. Prior to her most
      recent assignment, Ms. Kropf had been Executive Vice President and Chief
      Operating Officer, Avon North America and Global Business Operations from
      1998 to 2000. From 1997 to 1998 she was President, Avon U.S. Ms. Kropf was
      a member of Avon&#8217;s Board of Directors from 1998 to 2006. She currently is
      a member of the Board of Directors of Coach, Inc., MeadWestvaco
      Corporation, and Sherwin Williams Company. Ms. Kropf has served on those
      boards, as well as the board of Avon Products, during the past five years.
      She is a member of the Audit and Public Responsibilities
      Committees.</font></div>
              <div>&#160;</div>
              <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Ms. Kropf has
      gained a unique consumer insight, having led a major beauty care company.
      She has extensive experience in manufacturing, marketing, supply chain
      operations, customer service, and product development, all of which assist
      her in her role as a member of Kroger&#8217;s Board. Ms. Kropf has a strong
      financial background, and has served on compensation, audit, and corporate
      governance committees of other boards. She was inducted into the YWCA
      Academy of Women Achievers.</font></div>
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="1%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">&#160;</td>
            <td valign="top" width="2%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center">
              <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">61</font></div>
              <div>&#160;</div>
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="1%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">&#160;</td>
            <td valign="top" width="3%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">
              <div align="center"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">2007</font></div>
              <div>&#160;</div>
            </td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td align="left" nowrap valign="top" width="20%" bgcolor="#ffffff">&#160;</td>
            <td valign="top" width="1%" bgcolor="#ffffff">
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="72%" bgcolor="#ffffff">

            <td valign="top" width="1%" bgcolor="#ffffff">

            <td valign="top" width="2%" bgcolor="#ffffff">

            <td valign="top" width="3%" bgcolor="#ffffff">

          </tr><tr style="LINE-HEIGHT: normal;">
            <td align="left" nowrap valign="top" width="20%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">
              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">John T. LaMacchia</font></font></div>
              <div>&#160;</div>
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="1%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="72%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">
              <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Mr. LaMacchia
      served as Chairman of the Board of Tellme Networks, Inc., a provider of
      voice application networks, from September 2001 to May 2007. From
      September 2001 through December 2004 he was also Chief Executive Officer
      of Tellme Networks. From May 1999 to May 2000 Mr. LaMacchia was Chief
      Executive Officer of CellNet Data Systems, Inc., a provider of wireless
      data communications. From October 1993 through February 1999, he was
      President and Chief Executive Officer of Cincinnati Bell Inc. During the
      past five years, Mr. LaMacchia served on the board of Burlington Resources
      Inc. He is chair of the Compensation Committee and a member of the
      Corporate Governance Committee.</font></div>
              <div>&#160;</div>
              <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Mr. LaMacchia
      brings to Kroger his tenure leading both large and small companies. He has
      developed expertise in compensation and governance issues through his
      experience on compensation and corporate governance committees of Kroger
      and other boards.</font></div>
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="1%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="2%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center">

      Previously, Mr. Lewis has served on the Board of Directors of Conrail,

      Finance as well as his service and leadership on Kroger&#8217;s and other audit
      committees. He is a former chairman of the National Association of
      Securities Professionals.</font></div>

      executive, and investment committees of Cincinnati Financial Corporation
      adds depth to his extensive retail experience.</font></div>

              <td align="left" nowrap valign="top" width="20%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Clyde R. Moore</font></font></td>

                <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Mr. Moore is
      the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of First Service Networks, a
      national provider of facility and maintenance repair services. He is a
      director of First Service Networks. Mr. Moore is a member of the
      Compensation and Corporate Governance Committees.</font></div>
                <div>&#160;</div>

      management experience in public and private companies. He has sound

      broadens the scope of the Board&#8217;s experience to provide oversight to

                <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Susan M. Phillips</font></font></div>
                <div>&#160;</div>
              </td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="top" width="1%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">

              <td align="left" valign="top" width="68%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">
                <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Dr. Phillips is
      Dean and Professor of Finance at The George Washington University School
      of Business, a position she has held since 1998. She was a member of the
      Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System from December 1991
      through June 1998. Before her Federal Reserve appointment, Dr. Phillips
      served as Vice President for Finance and University Services and Professor
      of Finance in The College of Business Administration at the University of
      Iowa from 1987 through 1991. She is a director of State Farm Mutual
      Automobile Insurance Company, State Farm Life Insurance Company, State
      Farm Companies Foundation, National Futures Association, and the Chicago
      Board Options Exchange. Dr. Phillips also is a trustee of the Financial
      Accounting Foundation. She is a member of the Audit and Financial Policy
      Committees.</font></div>
                <div>&#160;</div>
                <div align="justify"><font size="2">Dr. Phillips brings to the Board strong
      financial acumen, along with a deep understanding of, and involvement
      with, the relationship between corporations and the government. Her
      experience in academia brings a unique and diverse viewpoint to the
      deliberations of the Board. Dr. Phillips has been designated an Audit
      Committee financial expert.</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="top" width="1%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">&#160;</td>

    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="left">
        <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="">
<tr valign="bottom">
              <td nowrap width="20%">&#160;</td>
              <td nowrap width="1%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center">

              <td nowrap width="68%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Professional</font></font></td>

              <td nowrap width="5%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Director</font></font></td>
            </tr><tr valign="bottom">
              <td nowrap width="20%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Name</font></font></td>
              <td nowrap width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</td>
              <td nowrap width="68%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Occupation (1)</font></font></td>
              <td nowrap width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</td>
              <td nowrap width="4%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Age</font></font></td>
              <td nowrap width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</td>
              <td nowrap width="5%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Since</font></font></td>
            </tr><tr valign="bottom">
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="top" width="20%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Steven R. Rogel</font></font></td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="top" width="1%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">&#160;</td>
              <td valign="top" width="68%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
                <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Mr. Rogel was elected Chairman of the Board of Weyerhaeuser
      Company, a forest products company, in 1999 and was President and Chief
      Executive Officer and a director thereof from December 1997 to January 1,
      2008 when he relinquished the role of President. He relinquished the CEO
      role in April of 2008 and retired as Chairman as of April 2009. Before
      that time Mr. Rogel was Chief Executive Officer, President and a director
      of Willamette Industries, Inc. He served as Chief Operating Officer of
      Willamette Industries, Inc. until October 1995 and, before that time, as
      an executive and group vice president for more than five years. Mr. Rogel
      is a director of Union Pacific Corporation and Energy<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Solutions</font>, Inc. He is a
      member of the Corporate Governance and Financial Policy
      Committees.</font></div>
                <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&#160;</div>
                <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font size="2">Mr. Rogel has extensive
      experience in management of large corporations at all levels. He brings to
      the Board a unique perspective, having led a national supplier of paper
      products prior to his recent retirement. Mr. Rogel previously served as
      Kroger&#8217;s Lead Director, and has served on compensation, finance, audit,
      and governance committees of other corporations.</font></div>
              </td>
              <td nowrap valign="top" width="1%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">
              </td>
              <td nowrap valign="top" width="4%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">67</font></td>
              <td nowrap valign="top" width="1%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">

              <td nowrap valign="top" width="5%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">1999</font></td>

              </td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="top" width="1%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="68%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
                <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Mr. Runde is a special advisor and a former Vice Chairman of Morgan
      Stanley, a financial services provider, where he has been employed since
      1974. He was a member of the Board of Directors of Burlington Resources
      Inc. prior to its acquisition by ConocoPhillips in 2006. Mr. Runde serves
      as a trustee of Marquette University and the Pierpont Morgan Library. He
      is a member of the Compensation and Financial Policy
      Committees.</font></div>
                <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&#160;</div>
                <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font size="2">Mr. Runde brings to Kroger&#8217;s
      Board a strong financial background, having led a major financial services
      provider. He has served on the compensation committee of a major
      corporation.</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="top" width="1%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">&#160;</td>
              <td nowrap valign="top" width="4%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font size="2">63</font></td>

              <td align="left" nowrap valign="top" width="20%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Ronald L.
    Sargent</font></font></td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="top" width="1%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">&#160;</td>
              <td valign="top" width="68%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
                <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Mr. Sargent is Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Staples,
      Inc., a consumer products retailer, where he has been employed since 1989.
      Prior to joining Staples, Mr. Sargent spent 10 years with Kroger in
      various positions. In addition to serving as a director of Staples, Mr.
      Sargent is a director of Mattel, Inc. He is chair of the Audit Committee
      and a member of the Public Responsibilities Committee.</font></div>
                <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&#160;</div>
                <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Mr. Sargent has over 30 years of retail experience, first with
      Kroger and then with increasing levels of responsibility and leadership at
      Staples, Inc. His efforts helped carve out a new market niche for the
      international retailer that he leads. His understanding of retail
      operations and consumer insights are of particular value to the Board. Mr.
      Sargent has been designated an Audit Committee financial
      expert.</font></div>

              <td nowrap width="4%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center">&#160;</td>

              </td>
              <td nowrap width="5%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Director</font></font></td>
            </tr><tr valign="bottom">
              <td nowrap width="20%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Name</font></font></td>
              <td nowrap width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</td>
              <td nowrap width="68%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Occupation (1)</font></font></td>
              <td nowrap width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</td>
              <td nowrap width="4%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Age</font></font></td>
              <td nowrap width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</td>
              <td nowrap width="5%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Since</font></font></td>
            </tr><tr valign="bottom">
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="top" width="20%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Bobby S. Shackouls</font></font></td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="top" width="1%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">&#160;</td>
              <td valign="top" width="68%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
                <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Until the merger of Burlington Resources Inc. and ConocoPhillips,
      which became effective in 2006, Mr. Shackouls was Chairman of the Board of
      Burlington Resources Inc., a natural resources business, since July 1997
      and its President and Chief Executive Officer since December 1995. He had
      been a director of that company since 1995 and President and Chief
      Executive Officer of Burlington Resources Oil and Gas Company (formerly
      known as Meridian Oil Inc.), a wholly-owned subsidiary of Burlington
      Resources, since 1994. Mr. Shackouls is a director of ConocoPhillips. He
      has been appointed by Kroger&#8217;s Board to serve as Lead Director. Mr.
      Shackouls is chair of the Corporate Governance Committee and a member of
      the Audit Committee.</font></div>
                <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&#160;</div>
                <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font size="2">Mr. Shackouls brings to the
      Board the critical thinking that comes with a chemical engineering
      background. His guidance of a major natural resources company, coupled
      with his corporate governance expertise, forms the foundation of his
      leadership role on Kroger&#8217;s Board.</font></div>
              </td>
              <td nowrap valign="top" width="1%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">
              </td>
              <td nowrap valign="top" width="4%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">59</font></td>
              <td nowrap valign="top" width="1%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">
              </td>
              <td nowrap valign="top" width="5%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">1999</font></td>
