      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="">
<tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">(1)</font></td>
            <td valign="top">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </td>
            <td valign="top" width="100%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Except as noted, each of the directors
      has been employed by his or her present employer (or a subsidiary) in an
      executive capacity for at least five years.</font></td>
          </tr></table>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font></div>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">14</font></font></div>
    </div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    </div>
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">I</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">NFORMATION</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;C</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ONCERNING</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">THE</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;B</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OARD</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;</font></font
><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OF</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;D</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">IRECTORS</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">C</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OMMITTEES</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OF</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">THE</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> B</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OARD</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The Board of Directors has a number of
standing committees including Audit, Compensation, and Corporate Governance
Committees. All standing committees are composed exclusively of independent
directors. All Board committees have charters that can be found on our corporate
website at www.thekrogerco.com under </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Guidelines on Issues of Corporate Governance</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">. During 2009, the Audit Committee met seven
times, the Compensation Committee met six times, and the Corporate Governance
Committee met two times. Committee memberships are shown on pages 8 through 14
of this Proxy Statement. The Audit Committee reviews financial reporting and
accounting matters pursuant to its charter and selects our independent
accountants. The Compensation Committee recommends for determination by the
independent members of our Board the compensation of the Chief Executive
Officer, determines the compensation of Kroger&#8217;s other senior management, and
administers some of our incentive programs. Additional information on the
Compensation Committee&#8217;s processes and procedures for consideration of executive
compensation are addressed in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis below.
The Corporate Governance Committee develops criteria for selecting and retaining
members of the Board, seeks out qualified candidates for the Board, and reviews
the performance of Kroger, the Board, and along with the other independent board
members, the CEO.</font></div>
      <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The Corporate Governance Committee will
consider shareholder recommendations for nominees for membership on the Board of
Directors. Recommendations relating to our annual meeting in June 2011, together
with a description of the proposed nominee&#8217;s qualifications and other relevant
information, must be submitted in writing to Paul W. Heldman, Secretary, and
received at our executive offices not later than January 14, 2011. Shareholders
who desire to submit a candidate for director should send the name of the
proposed candidate, along with information regarding the proposed candidate&#8217;s
background and experience, to the attention of Kroger&#8217;s Secretary at our
executive offices. The shareholder also should indicate the number of shares
beneficially owned by the shareholder. The Secretary will forward the
information to the Corporate Governance Committee for its consideration. The
Committee will use the same criteria in evaluating candidates submitted by
shareholders as it uses in evaluating candidates identified by the Committee.
These criteria are:</font></div>
      <ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Demonstrated ability in fields
  considered to be of value in the deliberations of the Board, including
  business management, public service, education, science, law, and
  government;<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Highest standards of personal
  character and conduct;<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Willingness to fulfill the
  obligations of directors and to make the contribution of which he or she is
  capable, including regular attendance and participation at Board and committee
  meetings, and preparation for all meetings, including review of all meeting
  materials provided in advance of the meeting; and<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Ability to understand the
  perspectives of Kroger&#8217;s customers, taking into consideration the diversity of
  our customers, including regional and geographic differences.</font> </li>
      </ul>
      <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Racial, ethnic, and gender diversity is an
important element in promoting full, open, and balanced deliberations of issues
presented to the Board, and is considered by the Corporate Governance Committee.
Some consideration also is given to the geographic location of director
candidates in order to provide a reasonable distribution of members from the
operating areas of the Company.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">15</font></font></div>
    </div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    </div>
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The Corporate Governance Committee typically
recruits candidates for Board membership through its own efforts and through
suggestions from other directors and shareholders. The Committee on occasion has
retained an outside search firm to assist in identifying and recruiting Board
candidates who meet the criteria established by the Committee.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">C</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ORPORATE</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;G</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OVERNANCE</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The Board of Directors has adopted
</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Guidelines on Issues of Corporate
Governance</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">. These
</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Guidelines</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">, which include copies of the current charters
for the Audit, Compensation, and Corporate Governance Committees, and the other
committees of the Board of Directors, are available on our corporate website at
www.thekrogerco.com. Shareholders may obtain a copy of the </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Guidelines </font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">by
making a written request to Kroger&#8217;s Secretary at our executive
offices.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">I</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">NDEPENDENCE</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The Board of Directors has determined that all
of the directors, with the exception of Messrs. Dillon and McMullen, have no
material relationships with Kroger and therefore are independent for purposes of
the New York Stock Exchange listing standards. The Board made its determination
based on information furnished by all members regarding their relationships with
Kroger. After reviewing the information, the Board determined that all of the
non-employee directors were independent because (i) they all satisfied the
independence standards set forth in Rule 10A-3 of the Securities Exchange Act of
1934, (ii) they all satisfied the criteria for independence set forth in Rule
303A.02 of the New York Stock Exchange Listed Company Manual, and (iii) other
than business transactions between Kroger and entities with which the directors
are affiliated, the value of which falls below the thresholds identified by the
New York Stock Exchange listing standards, none had any material relationships
with us except for those arising directly from their performance of services as
a director for Kroger.</font></div>
      <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">L</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">EAD</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> D</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">IRECTOR</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The Lead Director presides over all executive
sessions of the non-management directors, serves as the principal liaison
between the non-management directors and management, and consults with the
Chairman regarding information to be sent to the Board, meeting agendas, and
establishing meeting schedules. Unless otherwise determined by the Board, the
chair of the Corporate Governance Committee is designated as the Lead
Director.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">A</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">UDIT</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;C</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OMMITTEE</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> E</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">XPERTISE</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The Board of Directors has determined that
Susan M. Phillips and Ronald L. Sargent, independent directors who are members
of the Audit Committee, are &#8220;audit committee financial experts&#8221; as defined by
applicable SEC regulations and that all members of the Audit Committee are
&#8220;financially literate&#8221; as that term is used in the NYSE listing
standards.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">C</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ODE</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OF</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;E</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">THICS</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The Board of Directors has adopted
</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The Kroger Co. Policy on Business
Ethics</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">, applicable to all
officers, employees and members of the Board of Directors, including Kroger&#8217;s
principal executive, financial, and accounting officers. The </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Policy</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> is available
on our corporate website at www.thekrogerco.com. Shareholders may obtain a copy
of the </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Policy </font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">by making a written request to Kroger&#8217;s
Secretary at our executive offices.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">16</font></font></div>
    </div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    </div>
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">C</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OMMUNICATIONS</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">WITH</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">THE</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> B</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OARD</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The Board has established two separate
mechanisms for shareholders and interested parties to communicate with the
Board. Any shareholder or interested party who has concerns regarding
accounting, improper use of Kroger assets, or ethical improprieties may report
these concerns via the toll-free hotline (800-689-4609) or email address
(helpline@kroger.com) established by the Board&#8217;s Audit Committee. The concerns
are investigated by Kroger&#8217;s Vice President of Auditing and reported to the
Audit Committee as deemed appropriate by the Vice President of
Auditing.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Shareholders or interested parties also may
communicate with the Board in writing directed to Kroger&#8217;s Secretary at our
executive offices. The Secretary will consider the nature of the communication
and determine whether to forward the communication to the chair of the Corporate
Governance Committee. Communications relating to personnel issues or our
ordinary business operations, or seeking to do business with us, will be
forwarded to the business unit of Kroger that the Secretary deems appropriate.
All other communications will be forwarded to the chair of the Corporate
Governance Committee for further consideration. The chair of the Corporate
Governance Committee will take such action as he or she deems appropriate, which
may include referral to the Corporate Governance Committee or the entire
Board.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">A</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">TTENDANCE</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The Board of Directors met seven times in
2009. During 2009, all incumbent directors attended at least 75% of the
aggregate number of meetings of the Board and committees on&#160;which that
director served. Members of the Board are expected to use their best efforts to
attend all annual meetings of shareholders. All fifteen</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> </font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">members of the
Board then in office attended last year&#8217;s annual meeting.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">C</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OMPENSATION</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;C</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ONSULTANTS</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The Compensation Committee directly engages a
compensation consultant from Mercer Human Resource Consulting to advise the
Committee in the design of compensation for executive officers. In 2009, Kroger
paid that consultant $158,839 for work conducted for the Committee. Kroger, on
management&#8217;s recommendation, retained the parent and affiliated companies of
Mercer Human Resource Consulting to perform other services for Kroger in 2009,
for which Kroger paid $5,234,161. These other services primarily related to
insurance claims (for which Kroger was reimbursed by insurance carriers as
claims were adjusted), insurance brokerage and bonding commissions, and pension
consulting. Kroger also made payments to affiliated companies for insurance
premiums that were collected by the affiliated companies on behalf of insurance
carriers, but these amounts are not included in the totals referenced above, as
the amounts were paid over to insurance carriers for services provided by those
carriers. Although neither the Committee nor the Board expressly approved the
other services, the Committee determined that the consultant is independent
because (a) he was first engaged by the Committee before he became associated
with Mercer; (b) he works exclusively for the Committee and not for our
management; (c) he does not benefit from the other work that Mercer&#8217;s parent and
affiliated companies perform for Kroger; and (d) neither the consultant nor the
consultant&#8217;s team perform any other services on behalf of Kroger.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">In 2009 the Compensation Committee also
directly engaged a second compensation consultant, from Frederick W. Cook &amp;
Co., Inc., to review Kroger&#8217;s executive compensation. The Committee determined
that the consultant is independent because neither he nor his company provide
any other services for Kroger.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">17</font></font></div>
    </div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    </div>
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">B</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OARD</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;O</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">VERSIGHT</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OF </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">E</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">NTERPRISE</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> R</font></font><font styl
e="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ISK</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">While risk management is primarily the
responsibility of Kroger&#8217;s management team, the Board of Directors is
responsible for the overall supervision of our risk management activities. The
Board&#8217;s oversight of the material risks faced by Kroger occurs at both the full
Board level and at the committee level.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The Board&#8217;s Audit Committee has oversight
responsibility not only for financial reporting of Kroger&#8217;s major financial
exposures and the steps management has taken to monitor and control those
exposures, but also for the effectiveness of management&#8217;s processes that monitor
and manage key business risks facing Kroger, as well as the major areas of risk
exposure and management&#8217;s efforts to monitor and control that exposure. The
Audit Committee also discusses with management its policies with respect to risk
assessment and risk management.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Management provides regular updates throughout
the year to the respective committees regarding the management of the risks they
oversee, and each of these committees reports on risk to the full Board at each
regular meeting of the Board.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">In addition to the reports from the
committees, the Board receives presentations throughout the year from various
department and business unit leaders that include discussion of significant
risks as necessary. At each Board meeting, the Chairman and CEO addresses
matters of particular importance or concern, including any significant areas of
risk that require Board attention. Additionally, through dedicated sessions
focusing entirely on corporate strategy, the full Board reviews in detail
Kroger&#8217;s short- and long-term strategies, including consideration of significant
risks facing Kroger and their potential impact. The independent directors, in
executive sessions led by the Lead Director, address matters of particular
concern, including significant areas of risk, that warrant further discussion or
consideration outside the presence of Kroger employees.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">We believe that our approach to risk
oversight, as described above, optimizes our ability to assess
inter-relationships among the various risks, make informed cost-benefit
decisions, and approach emerging risks in a proactive manner for Kroger. We also
believe that our risk structure complements our current Board leadership
structure, as it allows our independent directors, through the five fully
independent Board committees, and in executive sessions of independent directors
led by an independent Lead Director, to exercise effective oversight of the
actions of management, led by Mr. Dillon as Chairman and CEO, in identifying
risks and implementing effective risk management policies and
controls.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">B</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OARD</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;L</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">EADERSHIP</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;S</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">TRUCTURE</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Our Board is composed of twelve independent
directors and two management directors, Mr. Dillon, the Chairman of the Board
and CEO, and Mr. McMullen, President and Chief Operating Officer. In addition,
as provided in our </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Guidelines on Issues of Corporate Governance</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">, the Board has designated one of the
independent directors as Lead Director. The Board has established five standing
committees &#8212; audit, compensation, corporate governance, financial policy, and
public responsibilities. Each of the Board committees is composed solely of
independent directors, each with a different independent director serving as
committee chair. We believe that the mix of experienced independent and
management directors that make up our Board, along with the independent role of
our Lead Director and our independent Board committees, benefits Kroger and its
shareholders.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The Board believes that it is beneficial to
Kroger and its shareholders to designate one of the directors as a Lead
Director. The Lead Director serves a variety of roles, including reviewing and
approving Board agendas, meeting materials and schedules to confirm the
appropriate topics are reviewed and sufficient time is allocated to each;
serving as liaison between the Chairman of the Board, management, and the
</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">18</font></font></div>
    </div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    </div>
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">non-management
directors; presiding at the executive sessions of independent directors and at
all other meetings of the Board of Directors at which the Chairman of the Board
is not present; and calling an executive session of independent directors at any
time. Bobby Shackouls, an independent director and the chair of the Corporate
Governance Committee, is currently our Lead Director. Mr. Shackouls is an
effective Lead Director for Kroger due to, among other things, his independence,
his deep strategic and operational understanding of Kroger obtained while
serving as a Kroger director, his corporate governance knowledge acquired during
his tenure as a member of our Corporate Governance Committee, his previous
experience on other boards, and his prior experience as a CEO of a Fortune 500
company.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">With respect to the roles of Chairman and CEO,
the </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Guidelines</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> provide that the Board believes that it is in
the best interests of Kroger and its shareholders for one person to serve as
Chairman and CEO. The Board recognizes that there may be circumstances in which
it is in the best interests of Kroger and its shareholders for the roles to be
separated, and the Board exercises its discretion as it deems appropriate in
light of prevailing circumstances. The Board believes that the combination or
separation of these positions should continue to be considered as part of the
succession planning process, as was the case in 2003 when the roles were
separated. Since 2004, the roles have been combined.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Our Board and each of&#160;its committees
conduct an annual evaluation to determine whether they are functioning
effectively. As part of this annual self-evaluation, the Board assesses whether
the current leadership structure continues to be appropriate for Kroger and its
shareholders. Our </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Guidelines</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> provide the flexibility for our Board to
modify our leadership structure in the future as appropriate. We believe that
Kroger, like many U.S. companies, has been well-served by this flexible
leadership structure.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">19</font></font></div>
    </div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    </div>
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 14pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; ">
<tr valign="bottom">
            <td nowrap width="99%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">C<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OMPENSATION&#160;<font size="2">D<font size="1">ISCUSSION </font><font size="1">AND&#160;</font></font></font></font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">A</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">NALYSIS</font></font></td>
          </tr></table><br>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">E</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">XECUTIVE</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;C</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OMPENSATION</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> &#8211; G</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ENERAL</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> P</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">RINCIPLES</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The Compensation Committee of the Board has
the primary responsibility for establishing the compensation of Kroger&#8217;s
executive officers, including the named executive officers who are identified in
the Summary Compensation Table below, with the exception of the Chief Executive
Officer. The Committee&#8217;s role regarding the CEO&#8217;s compensation is to make
recommendations to the independent members of the Board; those independent Board
members establish the CEO&#8217;s compensation.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The Committee&#8217;s philosophy on compensation
generally applies to all levels of Kroger management. It requires Kroger
to:</font></div>
      <ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Make total compensation
  competitive;<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Include opportunities for equity
  ownership as part of compensation; and<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Use incentive compensation to help
  drive performance by providing superior pay for superior results.</font>
</li>
      </ul>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The following discussion and analysis
addresses the compensation of the named executive officers, and the factors
considered by the Committee in setting compensation for the named executive
officers and making recommendations to the independent Board members in the case
of the CEO&#8217;s compensation. Additional detail is provided in the compensation
tables and the accompanying narrative disclosures that follow this discussion
and analysis.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">E</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">XECUTIVE</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> C</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OMPENSATION</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> &#8211; O</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">BJECTIVES</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The Committee has several related objectives
regarding compensation. First, the Committee believes that compensation must be
designed to attract and retain those best suited to fulfill the challenging
roles that executive officers play at Kroger. Second, some elements of
compensation should help align the interests of the officers with your interests
as shareholders. Third, compensation should create strong incentives for the
officers (a) to achieve the annual business plan targets established by the
Board, and (b) to achieve Kroger&#8217;s long-term strategic objectives. In developing
compensation programs and amounts to meet these objectives, the Committee
exercises judgment to ensure that executive officer compensation does not exceed
reasonable and competitive levels in light of Kroger&#8217;s performance and the needs
of the business.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">To meet these objectives, the Committee has
taken a number of steps over the last several years, including the
following:</font></div>
      <ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Consulted regularly with its
  independent advisor from Mercer Human Resource Consulting on the design of
  compensation plans and on the amount of compensation that is necessary and
  appropriate for Kroger&#8217;s senior leaders in light of the Committee&#8217;s
  objectives. In 2009, the Committee retained another independent consultant to
  determine whether the compensation plans and amounts comport with the
  Committee&#8217;s objectives and produce value for Kroger&#8217;s
  shareholders.<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Conducted an annual review of all
  components of compensation, quantifying total compensation for the named
  executive officers on tally sheets. The review includes an assessment for each
  named executive officer, including the CEO, of salary; performance-based cash
  compensation, or bonus (both annual and long-term); equity; accumulated
  realized and unrealized stock option gains and </font></li>
      </ul>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">20</font></font></div>
    </div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    </div>
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="justify">
        <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-FAMILY: ; ">
<tr valign="top">
              <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 9pt">
                <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left">
                <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">restricted
      stock values; the value of any perquisites; retirement benefits; severance
      benefits available under The Kroger Co. Employee Protection Plan; and
      earnings and payouts available under Kroger&#8217;s nonqualified deferred
      compensation program.</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr></table>
      </div>
      <ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Considered internal pay equity at
  Kroger. The Committee is aware of reported concerns at other companies
  regarding disproportionate compensation awards to chief executive officers.
  The Committee has assured itself that the compensation of Kroger&#8217;s CEO and
  that of the other named executive officers bears a reasonable relationship to
  the compensation levels of other executive positions at Kroger taking into
  consideration performance and differences in
  responsibilities.<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Recommended share ownership
  guidelines, adopted by the Board of Directors. These guidelines require
  directors, officers and some other key executives to acquire and hold a
  minimum dollar value of Kroger stock. The guidelines require the CEO to
  acquire and maintain ownership of Kroger shares equal to 5 times his base
  salary; the Vice Chairman (which position was eliminated during the latter
  part of 2009) and the Chief Operating Officer at 4 times their base salaries;
  Executive Vice Presidents, Senior Vice Presidents, and non-employee directors
  at 3 times their base salaries or annual base cash retainers; and other
  officers and key executives at 2 times their base salaries.</font> </li>
      </ul>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">E</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">STABLISHING</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> E</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">XECUTIVE</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> C</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OMPENSATION</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The independent members of the Board have the
exclusive authority to determine the amount of the CEO&#8217;s salary; the bonus
potential for the CEO; the nature and amount of any equity awards made to the
CEO; and any other compensation questions related to the CEO. In setting the
annual bonus potential for the CEO, the independent directors determine the
dollar amount that will be multiplied by the percentage payout under the annual
bonus plan applicable to all corporate management, including the named executive
officers. The independent directors retain discretion to reduce the percentage
payout the CEO would otherwise receive. The independent directors thus make a
separate determination annually concerning both the CEO&#8217;s bonus potential and
the percentage of bonus paid.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The Committee performs the same function and
exercises the same authority as to the other named executive officers. The
Committee&#8217;s annual review of compensation for the named executive officers
includes the following:</font></div>
      <ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">A detailed report, by officer,
  that describes current compensation, the value of equity compensation
  previously awarded, the value of retirement benefits earned, and any severance
  or other benefits payable upon a change of control.<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">An internal equity comparison of
  compensation at various senior levels. This current and historical analysis is
  undertaken to ensure that the relationship of CEO compensation to other senior
  officer compensation, and senior officer compensation to other levels in the
  organization, is equitable.<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Reports from the Committee&#8217;s
  compensation consultants (described below) comparing named executive officer
  and other senior executive compensation with that of other companies,
  primarily our competitors, to ensure that the Committee&#8217;s objectives of
  competitiveness are met.<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">A recommendation from the CEO
  (except in the case of his own compensation) for salary, bonus potential, and
  equity awards for each of the senior officers including the other named
  executive officers. The CEO&#8217;s recommendation takes into consideration the
  objectives established by and the reports received by the Committee as well as
  his assessment of individual job performance and contribution to our
  management team.<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Historical information regarding
  salary, bonus, and equity compensation for a 3-year period.</font> </li>
      </ul>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">21</font></font></div>
    </div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    </div>
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid" align="center">
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">In considering each of the factors above, the
Committee does not make use of a formula, but rather subjectively reviews each
in making its compensation determination.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">T</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">HE</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;C</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OMMITTEE</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#8217;</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">S</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;C</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OMPENSATION</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;C</font></font>
<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ONSULTANTS</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">AND</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> B</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ENCHMARKING</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">As referenced earlier in this proxy statement,
the Committee directly engages a compensation consultant from Mercer Human
Resource Consulting to advise the Committee in the design of compensation for
executive officers. The Mercer consultant conducts an annual competitive
assessment of executive positions at Kroger for the Committee. The assessment is
one of several bases, as described above, on which the Committee determines
compensation. The consultant assesses base salary; target annual
performance-based bonus; target cash compensation (the sum of salary and bonus);
annualized long-term incentive awards, such as stock options, other equity
awards, and performance-based long-term bonuses; and total direct compensation
(the sum of all these elements). The consultant compares these elements against
those of other companies in a group of publicly-traded food and drug retailers.
For 2009, the group consisted of:</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="60%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 14pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; ">
<tr valign="bottom">
            <td align="left" nowrap width="49%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Costco Wholesale</font></td>
            <td align="left" nowrap width="50%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Supervalu</font></td>
          </tr><tr valign="bottom">
            <td align="left" nowrap width="49%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">CVS</font></td>
            <td align="left" nowrap width="50%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Target</font></td>
          </tr><tr valign="bottom">
            <td align="left" nowrap width="49%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Great Atlantic &amp; Pacific Tea</font></td>
            <td align="left" nowrap width="50%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Walgreens</font></td>
          </tr><tr valign="bottom">
            <td align="left" nowrap width="49%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Rite Aid</font></td>
            <td align="left" nowrap width="50%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Wal-Mart</font></td>
          </tr><tr valign="bottom">
            <td align="left" nowrap width="49%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Safeway</font></td>
            <td align="left" nowrap width="50%">&#160; </td>
          </tr></table><br>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">This peer group is
the same group as was used in 2008.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The make-up of the compensation peer group is
reviewed annually and modified as circumstances warrant. Industry consolidation
and other competitive forces will change the peer group used over time. The
consultant also provides the Committee data from companies in &#8220;general
industry,&#8221; a representation of major publicly-traded companies. These data are
reference points, particularly for senior staff positions where competition for
talent extends beyond the retail sector.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">In 2009, the Committee directly engaged an
additional compensation consultant to conduct a review of Kroger&#8217;s executive
compensation. This consultant, from Frederic W. Cook &amp; Co., Inc., examined
the compensation philosophy, peer group composition, annual cash bonus, and
long-term incentive compensation including equity awards. The consultant
concluded that Kroger&#8217;s executive compensation program met the Committee&#8217;s
objectives, and that it provides a strong linkage between pay and
performance.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Kroger is the second-largest company as
measured by annual revenues when compared with the peer group referenced above
and is the largest traditional food and drug retailer. The Committee has
therefore sought to ensure that salaries paid to our executive officers are at
or above the median paid by competitors for comparable positions and to provide
annual bonus potentials to our executive officers that, if annual business plan
objectives are achieved, would cause their total cash compensation to be
meaningfully above the median.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">C</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OMPONENTS</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OF</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> E</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">XECUTIVE </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">C</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OMPENSATION</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;</font></font><fon
t style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">AT</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;K</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ROGER</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>Compensation for our named executive
officers is comprised of the following:</font></div>
      <ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Salary;<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Performance-Based Annual Cash
  Bonus (annual, non-equity incentive pay);<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Performance-Based Long-Term Cash
  Bonus (long-term, non-equity incentive pay);</font> </li>
      </ul>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">22</font></font></div>
    </div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    </div>
    <div>
    </div>
    <div>&#160;</div><!-- Part C -->

    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Equity;<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Retirement and other benefits;
  and</font> <br>&#160;
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Perquisites.</font> </li>
      </ul>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">S</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ALARY</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">We provide our named executive officers and
other employees a fixed amount of cash compensation &#8211; salary &#8211; for their work.
Salaries for named executive officers (with the exception of the CEO) are
established each year by the Committee. The CEO&#8217;s salary is established by the
independent directors. Salaries for the named executive officers were reviewed
in June.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>The amount of each executive&#8217;s
salary is influenced by numerous factors including:</font></div>
      <ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">An assessment of individual
  contribution in the judgment of the CEO and the Committee (or, in the
  </font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">case of the CEO, of the
  Committee and the independent directors);<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Benchmarking with comparable
  positions at peer group companies;<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Tenure; and<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Relationship with the salaries of
  other executives at Kroger.</font> </li>
      </ul>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The assessment of individual contribution is
based on a subjective determination, without the use of performance targets, in
the following areas:</font></div>
      <ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Leadership;<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Contribution to the officer
  group;<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Achievement of established
  objectives, to the extent applicable;<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Decision-making
  abilities;<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Performance of the areas or groups
  directly reporting to the officer;<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Increased
  responsibilities;<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Strategic thinking;
  and<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Furtherance of Kroger&#8217;s core
  values.</font> </li>
      </ul>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The named executive officers received salary
increases, to the amounts shown below, following the annual review of their
compensation in June.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="LINE-HEIGHT: 14pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: center; ">

          </tr><tr valign="bottom">
            <td align="left" nowrap width="84%">

            <td nowrap width="1%"><font size="2">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
      </font></td>

            <td align="left" nowrap width="1%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">

            <td align="left" nowrap width="1%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">
            </td>
            <td align="left" nowrap width="1%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">$</font></td>
            <td align="right" nowrap width="3%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">1,260,000</font></td>
          </tr><tr valign="bottom">
            <td align="left" nowrap width="84%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">J. Michael Schlotman</font></td>
            <td align="left" nowrap width="1%">
            </td>
            <td align="left" nowrap width="1%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">$</font></td>
            <td align="right" nowrap width="3%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">525,000</font></td>
            <td align="left" nowrap width="1%">
            </td>
            <td align="left" nowrap width="1%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">$</font></td>
            <td align="right" nowrap width="3%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">545,000</font></td>
            <td align="left" nowrap width="1%">
            </td>
            <td align="left" nowrap width="1%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">$</font></td>
            <td align="right" nowrap width="3%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">567,000</font></td>
          </tr><tr valign="bottom">

      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">23</font></font></div>
    </div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    </div>
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">P</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ERFORMANCE</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">-B</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ASED </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">A</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">NNUAL </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">C</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ASH </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">B</font></font><font style="DISPLAY
: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ONUS</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">A large percentage of our employees at all
levels, including the named executive officers, are eligible to receive a
performance-based annual cash bonus based on Kroger or unit performance. The
Committee establishes bonus potentials for each executive officer, other than
the CEO whose bonus potential is established by the independent directors.
Actual payouts, which can exceed 100% of the potential amounts, represent the
extent to which performance meets or exceeds the thresholds established by the
Committee.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The Committee considers several factors in
making its determination or recommendation as to bonus potentials. First, the
individual&#8217;s level within the organization is a factor in that the Committee
believes that more senior executives should have a substantial part of their
compensation dependent upon Kroger&#8217;s performance. Second, the individual&#8217;s
salary is a factor so that a substantial portion of a named executive officer&#8217;s
total cash compensation is dependent upon Kroger&#8217;s performance. Finally, the
Committee considers the reports of its compensation consultants to assess the
bonus potentials of the named executive officers in light of total compensation
paid to comparable executive positions in the industry.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The annual cash bonus potential in effect at
the end of the year for each named executive officer is shown below. Actual
bonus payouts are prorated to reflect changes, if any, to bonus potentials
during the year.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="LINE-HEIGHT: 14pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: center; ">

            </td>
            <td align="left" nowrap width="1%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">$</font></td>

            <td align="left" nowrap width="1%">
            </td>
            <td align="left" nowrap width="1%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">$</font></td>
            <td align="right" nowrap width="3%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">550,000</font></td>
          </tr></table><br>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The amount of bonus that the named executive
officers earn each year is determined by Kroger&#8217;s performance compared to
targets established by the Committee based on the business plan adopted by the
Board of Directors. In 2009, thirty percent of bonus was earned based on an
identical sales target for Kroger&#8217;s supermarkets and other business operations;
thirty percent was based on a target for EBITDA, excluding supermarket fuel;
thirty percent was based on implementation and results of a set of measures
under our strategic plan; and ten percent was based on the performance of new
capital projects compared to their budgets. An additional 5% would be earned if
Kroger achieved three goals with respect to its supermarket fuel operations;
achievement of at least 80% of the targeted fuel EBITDA as set forth in the
business plan, increase of at least 3% in gallons sold at identical fuel
centers, and achievement of the planned number of fuel centers placed in
service. Likewise, a 5% reduction in bonus would result if any of the three fuel
goals was not achieved.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Over time the Committee has placed an
increased emphasis on the strategic plan by making the target more difficult to
achieve. The bonus plan allows for minimal bonus to be earned at relatively low
levels to provide incentive for achieving even higher levels of
performance.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Following the close of the year, the Committee
reviewed Kroger&#8217;s performance against the identical sales, EBITDA, strategic
plan, and capital projects objectives and determined the extent to which Kroger
achieved those objectives. Kroger&#8217;s EBITDA, excluding impairment charges, for
2009 was $3.655 billion, and Kroger&#8217;s identical sales for 2009 were 2.3%. In
2009, Kroger&#8217;s supermarket fuel EBITDA was $89.192 million, or 81.1% of the goal
established at the beginning of the year. Kroger&#8217;s sale of fuel in identical
</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">24</font></font></div>
    </div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    </div>
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">supermarket fuel
centers was 591.6 million gallons, or 5.3% over the prior year. We placed 117
supermarket fuel centers in operation during 2009, exceeding our goal of 111
centers. As a result, the officers earned the additional 5% fuel bonus. As a
result of the Company&#8217;s performance when compared to the targets established by
the Committee, and based on the business plan adopted by the Board of Directors,
the named executive officers earned 38.450% of their bonus potentials, which
percentage payout is substantially lower than the bonus payouts over the last
several years, principally reflecting the degree to which Kroger failed to
achieve its EBITDA and sales goals.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The 2009 targets established by the Committee
for annual bonus amounts based on identical sales and EBITDA results, the actual
2009 results, and the bonus percentage earned in each of the components of named
executive officer bonus, were as follows:</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>

            <td nowrap width="6%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">2.3%</font></td>
            <td align="left" nowrap width="1%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">&#160;</td>
            <td align="right" nowrap width="4%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">2.001</font></td>
            <td align="left" nowrap width="2%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">%</font></td>
          </tr><tr valign="bottom">
            <td align="left" nowrap width="72%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">EBITDA</font></td>
            <td nowrap width="1%">&#160;</td>
            <td nowrap width="6%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">$4.005
      Billion</font></td>
            <td nowrap width="1%">
            </td>
            <td nowrap width="6%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">$4.152
      Billion</font></td>
            <td nowrap width="1%">
            </td>
            <td nowrap width="6%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">$3.655 Billion</font></td>
            <td align="left" nowrap width="1%">
            </td>
            <td align="right" nowrap width="4%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">0</font></td>
            <td align="left" nowrap width="2%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">%</font></td>
          </tr><tr valign="bottom">
            <td align="left" nowrap width="72%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Strategic Plan**</font></td>
            <td align="left" nowrap width="1%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">

            <td align="right" nowrap width="4%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">21.951</font></td>
            <td align="left" nowrap width="2%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">%</font></td>

            <td align="left" nowrap width="2%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">%</font></td>
          </tr><tr valign="bottom">
            <td align="left" nowrap width="72%">

            <td align="right" nowrap width="4%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">38.450</font></td>
            <td align="left" nowrap width="2%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">%</font></td>
          </tr></table>____________________<br>&#160;<br>
      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; ">
<tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">*</font></td>
            <td valign="top"><font size="2">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</font></td>
            <td valign="top" width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Identical sales of 4% pay at 100% if EBITDA goal is achieved. If
      EBITDA goal is not achieved, identical sales of 5% pay at
  100%.</font></td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td colspan="3" valign="top">&#160;</td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">**</font></td>
            <td valign="top">
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The
      Strategic Plan and Capital Projects components also were established by
      the Committee but are not disclosed as they are competitively
      sensitive.</font></td>
          </tr></table>
      <div align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">In 2009, as in all years, the Committee
retained discretion to reduce the bonus payout for named executive officers if
the Committee determined for any reason that the bonus payouts were not
appropriate. The independent directors retained that discretion for the CEO&#8217;s
bonus. Those bodies also retained discretion to adjust the targets under the
plan should unanticipated developments arise during the year. No adjustments
were made to the payout or the targets during 2009.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The percentage paid for 2009 represented and
resulted from performance that, due to a weak economy and persistent deflation,
did not meet our original business plan objectives. A comparison of bonus
percentages for the named executive officers in prior years demonstrates the
variability of incentive compensation:</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center">
        <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="20%" style="LINE-HEIGHT: 14pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; TEXT-ALIGN: center; ">
<tr valign="bottom">
              <td nowrap width="82%">
              </td>
              <td nowrap width="1%"><font size="2">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
      </font></td>
              <td colspan="2" nowrap width="16%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Annual Cash Bonus</font></font></td>
            </tr><tr valign="bottom">
              <td nowrap width="82%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Fiscal Year</font></font></td>
              <td nowrap width="1%">
              </td>
              <td colspan="2" nowrap width="16%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Percentage</font></font> </td>

              <td nowrap width="82%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">2003</font></td>
