              <td align="right" nowrap width="10%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">24.100</font></td>
              <td align="left" nowrap width="6%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">%</font></td>
            </tr><tr valign="bottom">
              <td nowrap width="82%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">2002</font></td>
              <td nowrap width="1%">&#160;</td>
              <td align="right" nowrap width="10%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">9.900</font></td>
              <td align="left" nowrap width="6%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">%</font></td>
            </tr><tr valign="bottom">
              <td nowrap width="82%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">2001</font></td>
              <td nowrap width="1%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0">
              </td>
              <td align="right" nowrap width="10%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">31.760</font></td>
              <td align="left" nowrap width="6%" bgcolor="#c0c0c0"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">%</font></td>
            </tr><tr valign="bottom">
              <td nowrap width="82%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">2000</font></td>
              <td nowrap width="1%">
              </td>
              <td align="right" nowrap width="10%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">80.360</font></td>
              <td align="left" nowrap width="6%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">%</font> </td>
            </tr></table><br><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">25</font></font></div>
    </div><br>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The actual amounts of annual performance-based
cash bonuses paid to the named executive officers for 2009 are shown in the
Summary Compensation Table under the heading &#8220;Non-Equity Incentive Plan
Compensation.&#8221; These amounts represent the bonus potentials for each named
executive officer multiplied by the percentage earned in 2009. In no event can
any participant receive a performance-based annual cash bonus in excess of
$5,000,000. Beginning with the 2009 annual cash bonus, the maximum amount that a
participant, including each named executive officer, can earn is further limited
to 200% of the participant&#8217;s potential amount.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">After considering recommendations made by its
compensation consultants, the Committee determined to reduce the number of
metrics considered for purposes of calculating annual bonuses. Beginning with
the annual bonus for 2010, thirty percent of bonus will be based on an identical
sales target for Kroger&#8217;s supermarkets and other business operations; thirty
percent will be based on a target for EBITDA, excluding supermarket fuel; and
forty percent will be based on implementation and results of a set of measures
under our strategic plan. An additional 5% will be earned if Kroger achieves
three goals with respect to its supermarket fuel operations, subject to
adjustment by the Committee based on the effects of certain fuel programs;
achievement of at least 80% of the targeted fuel EBITDA as set forth in the
business plan, increase of at least 3% in gallons sold at identical fuel
centers, and achievement of the planned number of fuel centers placed in
service.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">P</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ERFORMANCE</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">-B</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ASED</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> L</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ONG</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">-T</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ERM</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> C</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: 
inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ASH</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> B</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ONUS</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">After reviewing executive compensation with
its consultant in 2005, the Committee determined that the long-term component,
which was made up of equity awards, of Kroger&#8217;s executive compensation was not
competitive. The Committee developed a plan to provide an incentive to the named
executive officers to achieve the long-term goals established by the Board of
Directors by conditioning a portion of compensation on the achievement of those
goals. Beginning in 2006, approximately 140 Kroger executives, including the
named executive officers, are eligible to participate in a performance-based
cash bonus plan designed to reward participants for improving the long-term
performance of Kroger. Bonuses are earned based on the extent to which Kroger
advances its strategic plan by:</font></div>
      <ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">improving its performance in four
  key categories, based on results of customer surveys; and<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">reducing total operating costs as
  a percentage of sales, excluding fuel.</font> </li>
      </ul>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The 2006 plan consisted of two components. The
phase-in component measured improvements through fiscal year 2007. The other
component measured the improvements through fiscal year 2009. Actual payouts
were based on the degree to which improvements were achieved, and were awarded
in increments based on the participant&#8217;s salary at the end of fiscal year 2005.
Participants received a 1% payout for each point by which the performance in the
key categories increased, and a 0.25% payout for each percentage reduction in
operating costs. The Committee administers the plan and determined the bonus
payout amounts based on achievement of the performance criteria. Total operating
costs as a percentage of sales, excluding fuel, at the commencement of the 2006
plan were 28.78%, and at the end of the phase-in period were 27.89%. Combining
this operating cost improvement with our performance in our key categories
resulted in payouts for the phase-in component of 36.25% of the participant&#8217;s
annual salary in effect at the end of fiscal year 2005. Total operating costs as
a percentage of sales, excluding fuel, at the end of fiscal year 2009 were
27.38%. Combining this operating cost improvement with our performance in our
key categories resulted in payouts for the full four-year performance period of
59.75% of the participant&#8217;s annual salary in effect at the end of fiscal year
2005.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">26</font></font></div>
    </div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    </div>
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">After reviewing an analysis conducted by its
independent compensation consultant in 2007, the Committee determined that
continuation of the long-term cash bonus was necessary in order for long-term
compensation for the named executive officers to be competitive and to continue
to focus the officers on achieving Kroger&#8217;s long-term business objectives. As a
result, the Committee adopted a 2008 long-term bonus plan under which bonuses
are earned based on the extent to which Kroger advances its strategic plan
by:</font></div>
      <ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">improving its performance in four
  key categories, based on results of customer surveys;<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">reducing total operating costs as
  a percentage of sales, excluding fuel; and<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">improving its performance in
  eleven key attributes designed to measure associate satisfaction and</font>
  <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">one key attribute designed to measure
  how Kroger&#8217;s focus on its values supports how associates do</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">business, based on the results of associate
  surveys.</font> </li>
      </ul>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The 2008 plan measures improvements through
fiscal year 2011. Participants receive a 1% payout for each point by which the
performance in the key categories increases, a 0.25% payout for each percentage
reduction in operating costs, and a 1% payout based on improvement in associate
engagement measures. Total operating costs as a percentage of sales, excluding
fuel, at the commencement of the 2008 plan were 27.89%. Actual payouts are based
on the degree to which improvements are achieved, and will be awarded based on
the participant&#8217;s salary at the end of fiscal year 2007. In no event can any
participant receive a performance-based long-term cash bonus in excess of
$5,000,000.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Although the Committee is considering adoption
of a new 2010 long-term bonus plan, that plan has not yet been
adopted.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">E</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">QUITY</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Awards based on Kroger&#8217;s common stock are
granted periodically to the named executive officers and a large number of other
employees. Equity participation aligns the interests of employees with your
interests as shareholders, and Kroger historically has distributed equity awards
widely. In 2009, Kroger granted 3,598,620 stock options to approximately 7,100
employees, including the named executive officers, under one of Kroger&#8217;s
long-term incentive plans. The options permit the holder to purchase Kroger
common stock at an option price equal to the closing price of Kroger common
stock on the date of the grant. The Committee adopted a policy of granting
options only at one of the four Committee meetings conducted shortly following
Kroger&#8217;s public release of its quarterly earnings results.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Kroger&#8217;s long-term incentive plans also
provide for other equity-based awards, including restricted stock. During 2009
Kroger awarded 2,575,994 shares of restricted stock to approximately 11,130
employees, including the named executive officers. This amount is comparable to
amounts awarded over the past few years as we began reducing the number of stock
options granted and increasing the number of shares of restricted stock awards.
The change in Kroger&#8217;s broad-based equity program from predominantly stock
options to a mixture of options and restricted shares was precipitated by (a)
the perception of increased value that restricted shares offer, (b) the
retention benefit to Kroger of restricted shares, and (c) accounting conventions
that now require stock options to be expensed, making the change cost-neutral to
Kroger.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The Committee considers several factors in
determining the amount of options and restricted shares awarded to the named
executive officers or, in the case of the CEO, recommending to the independent
directors the amount awarded. These factors include:</font></div>
      <ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The compensation consultant&#8217;s
  benchmarking report regarding equity-based and other long-term</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">compensation awarded by our
  competitors;</font> </li>
      </ul>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">27</font></font></div>
    </div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    </div>
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The officer&#8217;s level in the
  organization and the internal relationship of equity-based awards
  within</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Kroger;<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Individual performance;
  and<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The recommendation of the CEO, for
  all named executive officers other than in the case of the CEO.</font>
</li>
      </ul>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The Committee has long recognized that the
amount of compensation provided to the named executive officers through
equity-based pay is often below the amount paid by our competitors. Lower
equity-based awards for the named executive officers and other senior management
permit a broader base of Kroger associates to participate in equity
awards.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Amounts of equity awards issued and
outstanding for the named executive officers are set forth in the tables that
follow this discussion and analysis.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">R</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ETIREMENT </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">AND</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> O</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">THER</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> B</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ENEFITS</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Kroger maintains a defined benefit and several
defined contribution retirement plans for its employees. The named executive
officers participate in one or more of these plans, as well as one or more
excess plans designed to make up the shortfall in retirement benefits created by
limitations under the Internal Revenue Code on benefits to highly compensated
individuals under qualified plans. Additional details regarding retirement
benefits available to the named executive officers can be found in the 2009
Pension Benefits table and the accompanying narrative description that follows
this discussion and analysis.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Kroger also maintains an executive deferred
compensation plan in which some of the named executive officers participate.
This plan is a nonqualified plan under which participants can elect to defer up
to 100% of their cash compensation each year. Compensation deferred bears
interest, until paid out, at the rate representing Kroger&#8217;s cost of ten-year
debt in the year of deferral as determined by Kroger&#8217;s CEO prior to the
beginning of each deferral year. In 2009, that rate was 6.15%. Deferred amounts
are paid out only in cash, in accordance with a deferral option selected by the
participant at the time the deferral election is made.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">We adopted The Kroger Co. Employee Protection
Plan, or KEPP, during fiscal year 1988. That plan was amended and restated in
2007. All of our management employees and administrative support personnel whose
employment is not covered by a collective bargaining agreement, with at least
one year of service, are covered. KEPP provides for severance benefits and
extended Kroger-paid health care, as well as the continuation of other benefits
as described in the plan, when an employee is actually or constructively
terminated without cause within two years following a change in control of
Kroger (as defined in the plan). Participants are entitled to severance pay of
up to 24 months&#8217; salary and bonus. The actual amount is dependent upon pay level
and years of service. KEPP can be amended or terminated by the Board at any time
prior to a change in control.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Stock option and restricted stock agreements
with participants in Kroger&#8217;s long-term incentive plans provide that those
awards &#8220;vest,&#8221; with options becoming immediately exercisable and restrictions on
restricted stock lapsing, upon a change in control as described in the
agreements.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">None of the named executive officers, except
Mr. McGeorge, is party to an employment agreement. Under that agreement, Mr.
McGeorge, former President and Chief Operating Officer, and former member of
Kroger&#8217;s Board of Directors, will continue as an active Kroger employee, and
will continue to receive his salary and other active employee benefits through
October 1, 2011. During that period, Mr. McGeorge will not engage in any
business activity in competition with Kroger&#8217;s retail business. Thereafter, his
active employment will cease and he will be eligible to receive retirement
benefits.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">28</font></font></div>
    </div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    </div>
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">P</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ERQUISITES</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The Committee does not believe that it is
necessary for the attraction or retention of management talent to provide the
named executive officers a substantial amount of compensation in the form of
perquisites. In 2009, the only perquisites provided were:</font></div>
      <ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">payments of premiums of life
  insurance, accidental death and dismemberment insurance, and long-</font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">term disability insurance policies, and
  reimbursement of the tax effects of the life insurance and</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">accidental death and dismemberment insurance
  payments; and<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">reimbursement for the tax effects
  of participation in a nonqualified retirement plan.</font> </li>
      </ul>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The life insurance benefit, along with
reimbursement of the tax effect of that benefit, was offered beginning several
years ago to replace a split-dollar life insurance benefit that was
substantially more costly to Kroger. Currently, 157 active executives, including
the named executive officers, and 65 retired executives, receive this benefit.
Beginning in 2010, Kroger no longer will reimburse the tax effects of insurance
premiums or participation in a nonqualified retirement plan, as these
&#8220;gross-ups&#8221; have been eliminated.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">In addition, the named executive officers are
entitled to the following benefit that does not constitute a perk as defined by
the SEC rules:</font></div>
      <ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">personal use of Kroger aircraft,
  which officers may lease from Kroger, and pay the average variable</font>
  <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">cost of operating the aircraft, making
  officers more available and allowing for a more efficient use of</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">their time.</font> </li>
      </ul>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The total amount of perquisites furnished to
the named executive officers is shown in the Summary Compensation Table and
described in more detail in footnote 6 to that table.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">E</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">XECUTIVE</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> C</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OMPENSATION</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> R</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ECOUPMENT</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> P</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OLICY</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">If a material error of facts results in the
payment to an executive officer at the level of Group Vice President or higher
of an annual bonus or a long-term bonus in an amount higher than otherwise would
have been paid, as determined by the Committee, then the officer, upon demand
from the Committee, will reimburse Kroger for the amounts that would not have
been paid if the error had not occurred. This recoupment policy applies to those
amounts paid by Kroger within 36 months prior to the detection and public
disclosure of the error. In enforcing the policy, the Committee will take into
consideration all factors that it deems appropriate, including:</font></div>
      <ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The materiality of the amount of
  payment involved;<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The extent to which other benefits
  were reduced in other years as a result of the achievement of</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">performance levels based on the
  error;<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Individual officer culpability, if
  any; and<br>&#160;</font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Other factors that should offset
  the amount of overpayment.</font> </li>
      </ul>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">S</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ECTION</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> 162 (M) </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OF</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">THE</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> I</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">NTERNAL</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> R</font></font><font style="DISPL
AY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">EVENUE</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> C</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ODE</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Tax laws place a limit of $1,000,000 on the
amount of some types of compensation for the CEO and the next four most highly
compensated officers that is tax deductible by Kroger. Compensation that is
deemed to be &#8220;performance-based&#8221; is excluded for purposes of the calculation and
is tax deductible. Awards under Kroger&#8217;s long-term incentive plans, when payable
upon achievement of stated performance criteria, should </font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">29</font></font></div>
    </div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    </div>
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">be considered
performance-based and the compensation paid under those plans should be tax
deductible. Generally, compensation expense related to stock options awarded to
the CEO and the next four most highly compensated officers should be deductible.
On the other hand, Kroger&#8217;s awards of restricted stock that vest solely upon the
passage of time are not performance-based. As a result, compensation expense for
those awards to the CEO and the next four most highly compensated officers is
not deductible, to the extent that the related compensation expense, plus any
other expense for compensation that is not performance-based, exceeds
$1,000,000.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Kroger&#8217;s bonus plans rely on performance
criteria, and have been approved by shareholders. As a result, bonuses paid
under the plans to the CEO and the next four most highly compensated officers
will be deductible by Kroger. In Kroger&#8217;s case, this group of individuals is not
identical to the group of named executive officers.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Kroger&#8217;s policy is, primarily, to design and
administer compensation plans that support the achievement of long-term
strategic objectives and enhance shareholder value. Where it is material and
supports Kroger&#8217;s compensation philosophy, the Committee also will attempt to
maximize the amount of compensation expense that is deductible by
Kroger.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center">
      </div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="LINE-HEIGHT: 14pt; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; ">
<tr>
            <td width="100%" style="BORDER-TOP: #000000 1pt solid">
              <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="2">C</font>OMPENSATION</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> C</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OMMITTEE</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> R</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">EPORT</font></font></div>
            </td>
          </tr></table>
      <div align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The Compensation Committee has reviewed and
discussed with management of the Company the Compensation Discussion and
Analysis contained in this proxy statement. Based on its review and discussions
with management, the Compensation Committee has recommended to the Company&#8217;s
Board of Directors that the Compensation Discussion and Analysis be included in
the Company&#8217;s proxy statement and incorporated by reference into its annual
report on Form 10-K.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Compensation
Committee:&#160;<br></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>John T. LaMacchia, Chair<br><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>Robert D. Beyer<br><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>Jorge P. Montoya<br><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>Clyde R. Moore<br><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>James A. Runde</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">30</font></font></div>
    </div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    </div>
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">E</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">XECUTIVE </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">C</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OMPENSATION</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">S</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">UMMARY </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">C</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OMPENSATION </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">T</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ABLE</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The following table shows the compensation of
the Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer, each of the Company&#8217;s
three most highly compensated executive officers other than the CEO and CFO, and
one additional former executive officer (the &#8220;named executive officers&#8221;) during
the fiscal years presented:</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>

      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; ">
<tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">(1)</font></td>
            <td valign="top">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</td>
            <td valign="top" width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Effective August 1, 2009, Mr. McMullen relinquished his position as
      Vice Chairman and became President and Chief Operating
  Officer.</font></td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">(2)</font></td>
            <td valign="top">
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Effective August 1, 2009, Mr. McGeorge relinquished his positions
      as President and Chief Operating Officer and became Special Advisor to the
      Chief Executive Officer. Effective December 1, 2009, Mr. McGeorge
      relinquished his responsibilities as Special Advisor to the Chief
      Executive Officer and was no longer an executive officer.</font></td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">(3)</font></td>
            <td valign="top">
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">These
      amounts represent the aggregate grant date fair value of awards computed
      in accordance with FASB ASC Topic 718.</font></td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">(4)</font></td>
            <td valign="top">
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Non-equity incentive plan compensation for 2009 consists of
      payments under an annual cash bonus and a long-term cash bonus program. In
      accordance with the terms of the 2009 performance-based annual cash bonus
      program, Kroger paid 38.45% of bonus potentials for the executive officers
      including the named executive officers, as follows: Mr. Dillon: $576,750;
      Mr. Schlotman: $192,250; Mr. McMullen: $384,500; Mr. McGeorge: $384,500;
      Mr. Becker: $211,475; and Mr. Heldman: $211,475. These
  amounts</font></td>
          </tr></table>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font></div>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">31</font></font></div>
    </div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    </div>
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; ">
<tr>
            <td valign="top">&#160;</td>
            <td valign="top">
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">were
      earned with respect to performance in 2009, and paid in March 2010. The
      2006 Long-Term Bonus Plan is a performance-based cash bonus plan designed
      to reward participants for improving the long-term performance of the
      Company. The first component of the plan covered performance during fiscal
      years 2006 and 2007, and the second component of the plan covered
      performance during fiscal years 2006, 2007, 2008, and 2009. The following
      amounts, representing payouts at 59.75% of bonus potentials, were earned
      under the second component of the plan and were paid in March 2010: Mr.
      Dillon: $657,250; Mr. Schlotman: $268,875; Mr. McMullen: $461,868; Mr.
      McGeorge: $461,868; Mr. Becker: $322,650; and Mr. Heldman:
    $369,255.</font></td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">(5)</font></td>
            <td valign="top">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</td>
            <td valign="top" width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Amounts are attributable to change in pension value and
      preferential earnings on nonqualified deferred compensation. Earnings on
      nonqualified deferred compensation are deemed to be preferential to the
      extent that they exceed 120% of the applicable federal long-term rate that
      corresponds most closely to the rate, when set, under the plan. Amounts
      deferred in 2009 bear interest at the average cost of Kroger&#8217;s ten-year
      debt, or 6.15%. One hundred twenty percent of the applicable federal rate
      is 5.26%. The rate of preferential earnings for amounts deferred in 2009
      is 0.89%. During 2009, pension values increased primarily due to: (i) a
      one percent decrease in the discount rate as determined by the plan
      actuary; (ii) increases in final average earnings used in determining
      pension benefits; (iii) an additional year of credited service; and (iv)
      an increase in present value due to participant aging. Since the benefits
      are based on final average earnings and service, the effect of the final
      average earnings increase is larger for those with longer service. Please
      refer to the 2009 Pension Benefits table for further information regarding
      credited service. The amount listed for Mr. Dillon includes preferential
      earnings on nonqualified deferred compensation in the amount of $557 and
      change in pension value in the amount of $3,629,484. The amount listed for
      Mr. McMullen includes preferential earnings on nonqualified deferred
      compensation in the amount of $4,891 and change in pension value in the
      amount of $1,296,851. The amount listed for Mr. Heldman includes
      preferential earnings on nonqualified deferred compensation in the amount
      of $1,347 and change in pension value in the amount of $1,274,054. The
      amounts for the remaining named executive officers represent only change
      in pension value.</font></td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">(6)</font></td>
            <td valign="top">
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The
      following table provides the items and amounts included in All Other
      Compensation for 2009:</font></td>
          </tr></table><br>

      <div align="justify">
        <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-FAMILY: ; ">
<tr valign="top">
              <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 9pt">
                <div align="justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left">
                <div align="justify">
                  <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The life
      insurance and payment of the tax effect of the premium payment by Kroger
      have been offered over the past several years to a large number of
      executives, including the named executive officers, in substitution for
      split-dollar life insurance coverage that was substantially more costly to
      Kroger. Excluded from the amounts shown in the table is income imputed to
      the named executive officer when accompanied on our aircraft during
      business travel by non-business travelers. These amounts for Mr. Dillon,
      Mr. Schlotman, and Mr. Heldman, calculated using the applicable terminal
      charge and Standard Industry Fare Level (SIFL) mileage rates, were $8,233,
      $1,443, and $818, respectively. The other named executive officers had no
      such imputed income for 2009. Separately, we require
      that</font></div>
                </div>
              </td>
            </tr></table>
      </div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">32</font></font></div>
    </div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    </div>
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="justify">
        <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-FAMILY: ; ">
<tr valign="top">
              <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 9pt">
                <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left">
                <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">officers who
      make personal use of our aircraft reimburse us for the average variable
      cost associated with the operation of the aircraft on such flights in
      accordance with a time-sharing arrangement consistent with FAA
      regulations. Beginning in 2010, Kroger no longer will compensate for the
      tax effects of the insurance premiums or the nonqualified retirement
      plan.</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr></table>
      </div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">G</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">RANTS </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OF </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">P</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">LAN</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">-B</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ASED </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">A</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">WARDS</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The following table provides information about
equity and non-equity awards granted to the named executive officers in
2009:</font></div>

<tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">(1)</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="top">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</td>
            <td valign="top" width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">These
      amounts represent the bonus potential of the named executive officer under
      the Company&#8217;s 2009 performance-based annual cash bonus
  program.</font></td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">(2)</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="top">
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">By the
      terms of this plan, no single cash bonus to a participant may exceed
      $5,000,000, and payouts are further limited to no more than 200% of a
      participant&#8217;s potential. The amount actually earned under this plan is
      shown in the Summary Compensation Table.</font></td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">(3)</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="top">
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">This
      amount represents the number of restricted shares awarded under one of the
      Company&#8217;s long-term incentive plans.</font></td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">(4)</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="top">
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">This
      amount represents the number of stock options granted under one of the
      Company&#8217;s long-term incentive plans.</font></td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">(5)</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="top">
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Options are granted at fair market value of Kroger common stock on
      the date of the grant. Fair market value is defined as the closing price
      of Kroger stock on the date of the grant.</font></td>
          </tr></table>
      <div align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The Compensation Committee of the Board of
Directors, and the independent members of the Board in the case of the CEO,
established bonus potentials, shown in this table as &#8220;target&#8221; amounts, for the
performance-based annual cash bonus award for the named executive officers.
Amounts were payable </font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">33</font></font></div>
    </div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    </div>
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">to the extent that
performance met specific objectives established at the beginning of the
performance period. As described in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis,
actual earnings can exceed the target amounts if performance exceeds the
thresholds.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Restrictions on restricted stock awards made
to the named executive officers lapse, as long as the officer is then in our
employ, in equal amounts on each of the five anniversaries of the date the award
is made, except that: restrictions on 30,000 shares awarded to Mr. Becker in
2008 lapse in 2011; 70,000 shares awarded to Mr. McMullen in 2009 vest as
follows: 15,000 shares on 6/25/2012, 20,000 shares on 6/25/2013, and 35,000
shares on 6/25/2014; 11,000 shares awarded to Mr. Heldman in 2006 vest as
follows: 3,000 shares on 5/4/2010 and 8,000 shares on 5/4/2011; and 30,000
shares awarded to Mr. Heldman in 2008 vest as follows: 6,000 shares on
6/26/2011, 12,000 shares on 6/26/2012, and 12,000 shares on 6/26/2013. Any
dividends declared on Kroger common stock are payable on restricted stock.
Nonqualified stock options granted to the named executive officers vest in equal
amounts on each of the five anniversaries of the date of grant. Those options
were granted at the fair market value of Kroger common stock on the date of the
grant. Options are granted only on one of the four dates of regularly scheduled
Compensation Committee meetings conducted shortly following Kroger&#8217;s public
release of its quarterly earnings results.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">O</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">UTSTANDING </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">E</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">QUITY </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">A</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">WARDS </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">AT </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">F</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ISCAL </font></font><font style="DI
SPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Y</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">EAR</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">-E</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ND</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The following table discloses outstanding

of the end of fiscal year 2009. Each outstanding award is shown separately.
Option awards include performance-based nonqualified stock options. The vesting
schedule for each award is described in the footnotes to this
table.</font></div>

            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">(4)</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="top">

            <td valign="top" width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Stock
      options vest in equal amounts on 6/26/2010, 6/26/2011, 6/26/2012, and
      6/26/2013.</font></td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td colspan="3" valign="top" width="100%">&#160;</td>

      <div align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">From 1997 through 2002, Kroger granted to the
named executive officers performance-based nonqualified stock options. These
options, having a term of ten years, vest six months prior to their date of
expiration unless earlier vesting because Kroger&#8217;s stock price achieved the
specified annual rate of appreciation set forth in the stock option agreement.
That rate ranged from 13% to 16%. To date, only the performance-based options
granted in 1997, 1998, 1999, and 2000 have vested, and those granted in 1997,
1998, and 1999 expired if not earlier exercised.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">O</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">PTION </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">E</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">XERCISES</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">AND</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> S</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">TOCK</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;V</font></font><font style="DISPLAY:
 inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ESTED</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>

      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Options granted under our various long-term
incentive plans have a ten-year life and expire if not exercised within that
ten-year period.</font></div>

    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br><a name="page_4"><!--EFPlaceholder-->
</a>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">P</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ENSION</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> B</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ENEFITS</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The following table provides information on
pension benefits as of 2009 year-end for the named executive
officers.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>

          </tr></table><br>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The named executive officers all participate
in The Kroger Consolidated Retirement Benefit Plan (the &#8220;Consolidated Plan&#8221;),
which is a qualified defined benefit pension plan. The Consolidated Plan
generally determines accrued benefits using a cash balance formula, but retains
benefit formulas applicable under prior plans for certain &#8220;grandfathered
participants&#8221; who were employed by Kroger on December 31, 2000. Each of the
named executive officers is eligible for these grandfathered benefits under the
Consolidated Plan. Their benefits, therefore, are determined using formulas
applicable under prior plans, including the Kroger formula covering service to
The Kroger Co. and the Dillon Companies, Inc. Pension Plan formula covering
service to Dillon Companies, Inc.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The named executive officers also are eligible
to receive benefits under The Kroger Co. Excess Benefit Plan (the &#8220;Kroger Excess
Plan&#8221;), and Mr. Dillon also is eligible to receive benefits under the Dillon
Companies, Inc. Excess Benefit Pension Plan (the &#8220;Dillon Excess Plan&#8221;). These
plans are collectively referred to as the &#8220;Excess Plans.&#8221; The Excess Plans are
each considered to be nonqualified deferred compensation plans as defined in
Section 409A of the Internal Revenue Code. The purpose of the Excess Plans is to
make up the shortfall in retirement benefits caused by the limitations on
benefits to highly compensated individuals under qualified plans in accordance
with the Internal Revenue Code.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Each of the named executive officers will
receive benefits under the Consolidated Plan and the Excess Plans, determined as
follows:</font></div>
      <ul style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">1&#189;% times years of credited
  service multiplied by the average of the highest five years of total
  earnings</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">(base salary and
  annual bonus) during the last ten calendar years of employment, reduced by
  1&#188;%</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">times years of credited
  service multiplied by the primary social security benefit;<br>&#160; </font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">normal retirement age is
  65;</font> </li>
      </ul>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">38</font></font></div>
    </div><br>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br><a name="page_5"><!--EFPlaceholder-->
</a>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <ul style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">unreduced benefits are payable
  beginning at age 62; and<br>&#160; </font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">benefits payable between ages 55
  and 62 will be reduced by &#185;/</font><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">3
  </font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">of one percent for each of the
  first</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">24 months and by &#189; of one
  percent for each of the next 60 months by which the commencement of</font>
  <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">benefits precedes age 62.</font>
</li>
      </ul>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Although participants generally receive
credited service beginning at age 21, those participants who commenced
employment prior to 1986, including all of the named executive officers, began
to accrue credited service after attaining age 25. In the event of a termination
of employment, Messrs. Becker, Dillon, Heldman, and McGeorge currently are
eligible for a reduced early retirement benefit, as they each have attained age
55.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Mr. Dillon also participates in the Dillon
Employees&#8217; Profit Sharing Plan (the &#8220;Dillon Plan&#8221;). The Dillon Plan is a
qualified defined contribution plan under which Dillon Companies, Inc. and its
participating subsidiaries may choose to make discretionary contributions each
year that are then allocated to each participant&#8217;s account. Participation in the
Dillon Plan was frozen effective January 1, 2001. Participants in the Dillon
Plan elect from among a number of investment options and the amounts in their
accounts are invested and credited with investment earnings in accordance with
their elections. Prior to July 1, 2000, participants could elect to make
voluntary contributions under the Dillon Plan, but that option was discontinued
effective as of July 1, 2000. Participants can elect to receive their Dillon
Plan benefit in the form of either a lump sum payment or installment
payments.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Due to offset formulas contained in the
Consolidated Plan and the Dillon Excess Plan, Mr. Dillon&#8217;s accrued benefit under
the Dillon Plan offsets a portion of the benefit that would otherwise accrue for
him under those plans for his service with Dillon Companies, Inc. Although
benefits that accrue under defined contribution plans are not reportable under
the accompanying table, we have added narrative disclosure of the Dillon Plan
because of the offsetting effect that benefits under that plan has on benefits
accruing under the Consolidated Plan and the Dillon Excess Plan.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The assumptions used in calculating the
present values are set forth in Note 13 to the consolidated financial statements
in Kroger&#8217;s Form 10-K for fiscal year 2009 ended January 30, 2010. The discount
rate used to determine the present values is 6%, which is the same rate used at
the measurement date for financial reporting purposes.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">N</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ONQUALIFIED</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> D</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">EFERRED</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> C</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OMPENSATION</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The following table provides information on
nonqualified deferred compensation for the named executive officers for
2009.</font></div>

<tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">(1)</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="top">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </td>
            <td width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">These amounts
      represent the deferral of annual bonus earned in fiscal year 2008 and paid
      in March 2009. These amounts are included in the Summary Compensation
      Table for 2008.</font></td>

      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font></div>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">39</font></font></div>
    </div><br>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br><a name="page_6"><!--EFPlaceholder-->
</a>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Eligible participants may elect to defer up to
100% of the amount of their salary that exceeds the sum of the FICA wage base
and pre-tax insurance and other Internal Revenue Code Section 125 plan
deductions, as well as 100% of their annual and long-term bonus compensation.
Deferral account amounts are credited with interest at the rate representing
Kroger&#8217;s cost of ten-year debt as determined by Kroger&#8217;s CEO prior to the
beginning of each deferral year. The interest rate established for deferral
amounts for each deferral year will be applied to those deferral amounts for all
subsequent years until the deferred compensation is paid out. Participants can
elect to receive lump sum distributions or quarterly installments for periods up
to ten years. Participants also can elect between lump sum distributions and
quarterly installments to be received by designated beneficiaries if the
participant dies before distribution of deferred compensation is
completed.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">D</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">IRECTOR</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> C</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OMPENSATION</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The following table describes the fiscal year
2009 compensation for non-employee directors. Employee directors receive no
compensation for their Board service.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>

      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font></div>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">40</font></font></div>

    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; ">
<tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">(9)</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="top">
            </td>
            <td width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">This amount
      reflects preferential earnings on nonqualified deferred compensation. For
      a complete explanation of preferential earnings, please refer to footnote
      5 to the Summary Compensation Table.</font></td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top">
            </td>
            <td nowrap valign="top">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </td>
            <td width="100%">
            </td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">(10)</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="top">
            </td>
            <td width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">This amount
      reflects the cost to the Company per director for providing accidental
      death and dismemberment insurance coverage for non-employee directors.
      These premiums are paid on an annual basis in
  February.</font></td>
          </tr></table>
      <div align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Each non-employee director receives an annual
retainer of $75,000. The chair of each committee receives an additional annual
retainer of $12,000. Each member of the Audit Committee receives an additional
annual retainer of $10,000. The director designated as the &#8220;Lead Director&#8221;
receives an additional annual retainer of $20,000. Each non-employee director
also receives annually, at the regularly scheduled Board meeting held in
December, restricted stock and nonqualified stock option awards. On December 10,
2009 each non-employee director received 3,250 shares of restricted stock and an
award of 6,500 nonqualified stock options.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Non-employee directors first elected prior to
July 17, 1997 receive a major medical plan benefit as well as an unfunded
retirement benefit. The retirement benefit equals the average cash compensation
for the five calendar years preceding retirement. Participants who retire from
the Board prior to age 70 will be credited with 50% vesting after five years of
service, and 10% for each additional year up to a maximum of 100%. Benefits for
participants who retire prior to age 70 begin at the later of actual retirement
or age 65.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">We also maintain a deferred compensation plan,
in which all non-employee members of the Board are eligible to participate.
Participants may defer up to 100% of their cash compensation. They may elect
from either or both of the following two alternative methods of determining
benefits:</font></div>
      <ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">interest accrues until paid out at
  the rate of interest determined prior to the beginning of the deferral year to
  represent Kroger&#8217;s cost of ten-year debt; and<br>&#160; </font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">amounts are credited in &#8220;phantom&#8221;
  stock accounts and the amounts in those accounts fluctuate with</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">the price of Kroger common stock.</font>
  </li>
      </ul>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">In both cases, deferred amounts are paid out
only in cash, based on deferral options selected by the participants at the time
the deferral elections are made. Participants can elect to have distributions
made in a lump sum or in quarterly installments, and may make comparable
elections for designated beneficiaries who receive benefits in the event that
deferred compensation is not completely paid out upon the death of the
participant.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The Board has determined that compensation of
non-employee directors must be competitive on an on-going basis to attract and
retain directors who meet the qualifications for service on Kroger&#8217;s Board.
Non-employee director compensation will be reviewed from time to time as the
Corporate Governance Committee deems appropriate.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">P</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OTENTIAL</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> P</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">AYMENTS</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">UPON</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> T</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ERMINATION</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> </font></font><font style="DI
SPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OR</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> C</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">HANGE</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">IN</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> C</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ONTROL</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Other than an agreement with Mr. McGeorge,
Kroger has no contracts, agreements, plans or arrangements that provide for
payments to the named executive officers in connection with resignation,
severance, retirement, termination, or change in control, except for those
available generally to salaried employees. The Kroger Co. Employee Protection
Plan, or KEPP, applies to all management employees and administrative support
personnel who are not covered by a collective bargaining agreement, with at
least one year of service, and provides severance benefits when a participant&#8217;s
employment is terminated actually or constructively within two years following a
change in control of Kroger. For purposes of KEPP, a change in control occurs
if:</font></div>
      <ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">any person or entity (excluding
  Kroger&#8217;s employee benefit plans) acquires 20% or more of the voting power of
  Kroger;</font> </li>
      </ul>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">41</font></font></div>
    </div><br>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br><a name="page_8"><!--EFPlaceholder-->
</a>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">a merger, consolidation, share
  exchange, division, or other reorganization or transaction with Kroger results
  in Kroger&#8217;s voting securities existing prior to that event representing less
  than 60% of the combined voting power immediately after the event;<br>&#160;
  </font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Kroger&#8217;s shareholders approve a
  plan of complete liquidation or winding up of Kroger or an agreement for the
  sale or disposition of all or substantially all of Kroger&#8217;s assets;
  or<br>&#160; </font>
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">during any period of 24
  consecutive months, individuals at the beginning of the period who
  constituted</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Kroger&#8217;s Board of
  Directors cease for any reason to constitute at least a majority of the Board
  of</font> <font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Directors.</font> </li>
      </ul>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Assuming that a change in control occurred on
the last day of Kroger&#8217;s fiscal year 2009, and the named executive officers had
their employment terminated, they would receive a maximum payment, or, in the
case of group term life insurance, a benefit having a cost to Kroger, in the
amounts shown below:</font></div>
