          </tr></table><br>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Each of the named executive officers also is
entitled to continuation of health care coverage for up to 24 months at the same
contribution rate as existed prior to the change in control. The cost to Kroger
cannot be calculated, as Kroger self insures the health care benefit and the
cost is based on the health care services utilized by the participant and
eligible dependents.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Under KEPP benefits will be reduced, to the
extent necessary, so that payments to an executive officer will in no event
exceed 2.99 times the officer&#8217;s average W-2 earnings over the preceding five
years.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Kroger&#8217;s change in control benefits under KEPP
and under stock option and restricted stock agreements are discussed further in
the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section under the &#8220;Retirement and Other
Benefits&#8221; heading.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">On June 24, 2009, we entered into an agreement
with Don W. McGeorge regarding an orderly transition of his responsibilities and
his retirement. Pursuant to that agreement, effective August 1, 2009, Mr.
McGeorge relinquished his duties and responsibilities as President and Chief
Operating Officer and assumed the office of Special Advisor to the CEO.
Effective December 1, 2009, Mr. McGeorge relinquished his responsibilities as
Special Advisor, was no longer an officer of Kroger, and retired from the Board.
Mr. McGeorge will continue as an active employee through October 1, 2011, after
which he will retire and will be eligible to receive retirement benefits. Prior
to that time, he will continue to receive his annual salary of $890,000 and his
annual performance-based bonus, based on his bonus potential of $1,000,000, at
the same rate earned by the other participants in the corporate plan. Mr.
McGeorge will be eligible for a performance-based long-term bonus under the 2008
Long-Term Bonus Plan, based on his potential for that plan of $833,000, at the
same rate earned by the other participants under that plan. He will continue to
be treated as an active employee under Kroger&#8217;s stock incentive and employee
benefit plans, and will not engage in any business activity in competition with
Kroger&#8217;s retail business through October 1, 2011.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">42</font></font></div>
    </div><br>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br><a name="page_9"><!--EFPlaceholder-->
</a>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">C</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OMPENSATION</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> P</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OLICIES</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">AS</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">THEY</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> R</font></font><font style="DISPLAY
: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ELATE</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">TO</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> R</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ISK</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> M</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ANAGEMENT</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Kroger&#8217;s compensation policies and practices
for its employees are designed to attract and retain highly qualified and
engaged employees, and to minimize risks that would have a material adverse
effect on Kroger. One of these policies, the executive compensation recoupment
policy, is more particularly described in the Compensation Discussion and
Analysis. Kroger does not believe that its compensation policies and practices
create risks that are reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on
Kroger.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">B</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ENEFICIAL</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> O</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">WNERSHIP</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OF</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> C</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OMMON</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> S</font></font><font style="DISPLAY
: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">TOCK</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">As of February 13, 2010, Kroger&#8217;s directors,

          </tr></table>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font></div>

      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; ">
<tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">(1)</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="top">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</td>
            <td valign="top" width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Shares
      beneficially owned by plan trustees for the benefit of participants in
      employee benefit plan.</font></td>
          </tr></table>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font></div>
      <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">S</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ECTION</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> 16(</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">A</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">) B</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ENEFICIAL</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> O</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">WNERSHIP</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> R</font></font><fon
t style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">EPORTING</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> C</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OMPLIANCE</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Section 16(a) of the Securities Exchange Act
of 1934 requires our officers and directors, and persons who own more than 10%
of a registered class of our equity securities, to file reports of ownership and
changes in ownership with the Securities and Exchange Commission. Those
officers, directors and shareholders are required by SEC regulation to furnish
us with copies of all Section 16(a) forms they file.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Based solely on our review of the copies of
forms received by Kroger, and any written representations from certain reporting
persons that no Forms 5 were required for those persons, we believe that during
fiscal year 2009 all filing requirements applicable to our officers, directors
and 10% beneficial owners were timely satisfied, with one exception. Mr. Ronald
L. Sargent filed a Form 4 three days late reporting phantom shares received in
connection with a deferred compensation plan due to a technical failure by the
plan record keeper that caused him to receive late notification of the
transaction.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">44</font></font></div>
    </div><br>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br><a name="page_11"><!--EFPlaceholder-->
</a>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">R</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ELATED</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> P</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ERSON</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> T</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">RANSACTIONS</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Pursuant to our </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Statement of Policy with Respect to Related Person Transactions
</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">and the rules of the SEC,
Kroger has the following related person transactions, which were approved by
Kroger&#8217;s Audit Committee, to disclose:</font></div>
      <ul style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">During fiscal year 2009, Kroger
  entered into a series of purchase transactions with Staples, Inc., totaling
  approximately $17.7 million. This amount represents substantially less than 2%
  of Staples&#8217; annual consolidated gross revenue. The vast majority of this
  amount represents purchases of office supplies and equipment that previously
  had been made from Corporate Express until its acquisition by Staples in July
  2008. Kroger&#8217;s relationship with Corporate Express existed prior to its
  acquisition by Staples. Ronald L. Sargent, a member of Kroger&#8217;s Board of
  Directors, is Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Staples</font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">.</font><br>&#160;
          </li>
        <li><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">During fiscal year 2009, Kroger
  paid J.P. Morgan/Chase approximately $380,000 for commercial banking fees.
  This amount represents substantially less than 2% of J.P. Morgan/Chase&#8217;s
  annual consolidated gross revenue. The son of Kroger CFO J. Michael Schlotman
  was employed by J.P. Morgan during a portion of fiscal year 2009, but had no
  responsibility for or involvement with any services provided to
  Kroger</font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">.</font> </li>
      </ul>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Director independence is discussed above under
the heading &#8220;Information Concerning the Board of Directors.&#8221; Kroger&#8217;s policy on
related person transactions is as follows:</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">S</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">TATEMENT</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OF</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;P</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OLICY <br>WITH</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> R</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ESPECT</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> </font></font><font styl
e="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">TO<br></font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">R</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ELATED</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> P</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ERSON</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> T</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">RANSACTIONS</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">A. I</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">NTRODUCTION</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">It is the policy of Kroger&#8217;s Board of
Directors that any Related Person Transaction may be consummated or may continue
only if the Committee approves or ratifies the transaction in accordance with
the guidelines set forth in this policy. The Board of Directors has determined
that the Audit Committee of the Board is best suited to review and approve
Related Person Transactions.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>For the purposes of this policy, a
&#8220;Related Person&#8221; is:</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; ">
<tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </td>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">1.</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="top">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </td>
            <td valign="top" width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">any
      person who is, or at any time since the beginning of Kroger&#8217;s last fiscal
      year was, a director or executive officer of Kroger or a nominee to become
      a director of Kroger;</font></td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td valign="top">
            </td>
            <td colspan="3" valign="top" width="100%">&#160;</td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top">
            </td>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">2.</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="top">
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">any
      person who is known to be the beneficial owner of more than 5% of any
      class of Kroger&#8217;s voting securities; and</font></td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td valign="top">
            </td>
            <td colspan="3" valign="top" width="100%">&#160;</td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top">
            </td>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">3.</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="top">
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">any
      immediate family member of any of the foregoing persons, which means any
      child, stepchild, parent, stepparent, spouse, sibling, mother-in-law,
      father-in-law, son-in-law, daughter-in-law, brother-in-law, or
      sister-in-law of the director, executive officer, nominee or more than 5%
      beneficial owner, and any person (other than a tenant or employee) sharing
      the household of such director, executive officer, nominee or more than 5%
      beneficial owner.</font></td>
          </tr></table>
      <div align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">For the purposes of this policy, a &#8220;Related
Person Transaction&#8221; is a transaction, arrangement or relationship (or any series
of similar transactions, arrangements or relationships) since the beginning of
Kroger&#8217;s last fiscal year in which Kroger (including any of its subsidiaries)
was, is or will be a participant </font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">45</font></font></div>
    </div><br>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br><a name="page_12"><!--EFPlaceholder-->
</a>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">and the amount
involved exceeds $120,000, and in which any Related Person had, has or will have
a direct or indirect material interest (other than solely as a result of being a
director or a less than 10 percent beneficial owner of another
entity).</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Audit
Committee has reviewed the following types of transactions and has determined
that each type of transaction is deemed to be pre-approved, even if the amount
involved exceeds $120,000.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; ">
<tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </td>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">1.</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="top">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </td>
            <td width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Certain Transactions
      with Other Companies</font>. Any transaction for property or services in
      the ordinary course of business involving payments to or from another
      company at which a Related Person&#8217;s only relationship is as an employee
      (including an executive officer), director, or beneficial owner of less
      than 10% of that company&#8217;s shares, if the aggregate amount involved in any
      fiscal year does not exceed the greater of $1,000,000 or 2 percent of that
      company&#8217;s annual consolidated gross revenues.</font></td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap>
            </td>
            <td colspan="3" width="100%">&#160;</td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top">
            </td>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">2.</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="top">
            </td>
            <td width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Certain Company
      Charitable Contributions</font>. Any charitable contribution, grant or
      endowment by Kroger (or one of its foundations) to a charitable
      organization, foundation, university or other not for profit organization
      at which a Related Person&#8217;s only relationship is as an employee (including
      an executive officer) or as a director, if the aggregate amount involved
      does not exceed $250,000 or 5 percent, whichever is lesser, of the
      charitable organization&#8217;s latest publicly available annual consolidated
      gross revenues.</font></td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap>
            </td>
            <td colspan="3" width="100%">&#160;</td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top">
            </td>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">3.</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="top">
            </td>
            <td width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Transactions where all
      Shareholders Receive Proportional Benefits</font>. Any transaction where
      the Related Person&#8217;s interest arises solely from the ownership of Kroger
      common stock and all holders of Kroger common stock received the same
      benefit on a pro rata basis.</font></td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap>
            </td>
            <td colspan="3" width="100%">&#160;</td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top">
            </td>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">4.</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="top">
            </td>
            <td width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Executive Officer and
      Director Compensation</font>. (a) Any employment by Kroger of an executive
      officer if the executive officer&#8217;s compensation is required to be reported
      in Kroger&#8217;s proxy statement, (b) any employment by Kroger of an executive
      officer if the executive officer is not an immediate family member of a
      Related Person and the Compensation Committee approved (or recommended
      that the Board approve) the executive officer&#8217;s compensation, and (c) any
      compensation paid to a director if the compensation is required to be
      reported in Kroger&#8217;s proxy statement.</font></td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap>
            </td>
            <td colspan="3" width="100%">&#160;</td>
          </tr><tr>
            <td nowrap valign="top">
            </td>
            <td nowrap valign="top"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">5.</font></td>
            <td nowrap valign="top">
            </td>
            <td width="100%"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Other
      Transactions</font>. (a) Any transaction involving a Related Person where
      the rates or charges involved are determined by competitive bids, (b) any
      transaction with a Related Person involving the rendering of services as a
      common or contract carrier, or public utility, at rates or charges fixed
      in conformity with law or governmental authority, or (c) any transaction
      with a Related Person involving services as a bank depositary of funds,
      transfer agent, registrar, trustee under a trust indenture or similar
      services.</font></td>
          </tr></table>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font></div>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">B. A</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">UDIT</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> C</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OMMITTEE</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> A</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">PPROVAL</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">In the event management becomes aware of any
Related Person Transactions that are not deemed pre-approved under paragraph A
of this policy, those transactions will be presented to the Committee for
approval at the next regular Committee meeting, or where it is not practicable
or desirable to wait until the next regular Committee meeting, to the Chair of
the Committee (who will possess delegated authority to act between Committee
meetings) subject to ratification by the Committee at its next regular meeting.
If advance approval of a Related Person Transaction is not feasible, then the
Related Person Transaction will </font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">46</font></font></div>
    </div><br>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%"><!-- Part E -->

    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">be presented to the
Committee for ratification at the next regular Committee meeting, or where it is
not practicable or desirable to wait until the next regular Committee meeting,
to the Chair of the Committee for ratification, subject to further ratification
by the Committee at its next regular meeting.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;In connection with
each regular Committee meeting, a summary of each new Related Person Transaction
deemed pre-approved pursuant to paragraphs A(1) and A(2) above will be provided
to the Committee for its review.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;If a Related Person
Transaction will be ongoing, the Committee may establish guidelines for
management to follow in its ongoing dealings with the Related Person.
Thereafter, the Committee, on at least an annual basis, will review and assess
ongoing relationships with the Related Person to see that they are in compliance
with the Committee&#8217;s guidelines and that the Related Person Transaction remains
appropriate.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;The Committee (or the
Chair) will approve only those Related Person Transactions that are in, or are
not inconsistent with, the best interests of Kroger and its shareholders, as the
Committee (or the Chair) determines in good faith in accordance with its
business judgment.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;No director will
participate in any discussion or approval of a Related Person Transaction for
which he or she, or an immediate family member (as defined above), is a Related
Person except that the director will provide all material information about the
Related Person Transaction to the Committee.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">C. D</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ISCLOSURE</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;Kroger will disclose
all Related Person Transactions in Kroger&#8217;s applicable filings as required by
the Securities Act of 1933, the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and related
rules.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">47</font></font></div>
    </div><br>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br><a name="page_2"><!--EFPlaceholder-->
</a>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">A</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">UDIT</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> C</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OMMITTEE</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> R</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">EPORT</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;The primary function
of the Audit Committee is to represent and assist the Board of Directors in
fulfilling its oversight responsibilities regarding the Company&#8217;s financial
reporting and accounting practices including the integrity of the Company&#8217;s
financial statements; the Company&#8217;s compliance with legal and regulatory
requirements; the independent public accountants&#8217; qualifications and
independence; the performance of the Company&#8217;s internal audit function and
independent public accountants; and the preparation of this report that SEC
rules require be included in the Company&#8217;s annual proxy statement. The Audit
Committee performs this work pursuant to a written charter approved by the Board
of Directors. The Audit Committee charter most recently was revised during
fiscal 2010 and is available on the Company&#8217;s website at
http://www.thekrogerco.com/documents/GuidelinesIssues.pdf. The Audit Committee
has implemented procedures to assist it during the course of each fiscal year in
devoting the attention that is necessary and appropriate to each of the matters
assigned to it under the Committee&#8217;s charter. The Audit Committee held seven
meetings during fiscal year 2009. The Audit Committee meets separately with the
Company&#8217;s internal auditor and PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP, the Company&#8217;s
independent public accountants, without management present, to discuss the
results of their audits, their evaluations of the Company&#8217;s internal control
over financial reporting, and the overall quality of the Company&#8217;s financial
reporting. The Audit Committee also meets separately with the Company&#8217;s Chief
Financial Officer and General Counsel when needed. Following these separate
discussions, the Audit Committee meets in executive session.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;Management of the
Company is responsible for the preparation and presentation of the Company&#8217;s
financial statements, the Company&#8217;s accounting and financial reporting
principles and internal controls, and procedures that are designed to provide
reasonable assurance regarding compliance with accounting standards and
applicable laws and regulations. The independent public accountants are
responsible for auditing the Company&#8217;s financial statements and expressing
opinions as to the financial statements&#8217; conformity with generally accepted
accounting principles and the effectiveness of the Company&#8217;s internal control
over financial reporting.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;In the performance of
its oversight function, the Audit Committee has reviewed and discussed with
management and PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP the audited financial statements for
the year ended January 30, 2010, management&#8217;s assessment of the effectiveness of
the Company&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting as of January 30, 2010,
and PricewaterhouseCoopers&#8217; evaluation of the Company&#8217;s internal control over
financial reporting as of that date. The Audit Committee has also discussed with
the independent public accountants the matters that the independent public
accountants must communicate to the Audit Committee under applicable
requirements of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;With respect to the
Company&#8217;s independent public accountants, the Audit Committee, among other
things, discussed with PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP matters relating to its
independence and has received the written disclosures and the letter from the
independent public accountants required by applicable requirements of the Public
Company Accounting Oversight Board regarding the independent public accountants&#8217;
communications with the Audit Committee concerning independence. The Audit
Committee has reviewed and approved in advance all services provided to the
Company by PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP. The Audit Committee conducted a review of
services provided by PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP which included an evaluation by
management and members of the Audit Committee.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">48</font></font></div>
    </div><br>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br><a name="page_3"><!--EFPlaceholder-->
</a>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;Based upon the review
and discussions described in this report, the Audit Committee recommended to the
Board of Directors that the audited consolidated financial statements be
included in the Company&#8217;s Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended January
30, 2010, as filed with the SEC.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;This report is
submitted by the Audit Committee. </font></div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#160;</font></div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Ronald L. Sargent,
Chair </font></div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Susan J. Kropf
</font></div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Susan M. Phillips
</font></div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Bobby S.
Shackouls</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">49</font></font></div>
    </div><br>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br><a name="page_4"><!--EFPlaceholder-->
</a>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">A</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">MENDMENT</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">TO</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">THE</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> C</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OMPANY</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">&#8217;</font></font><font sty
le="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">S</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> A</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">RTICLES</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OF</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> I</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">NCORPORATION</font></font></div>
      <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">(I</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">TEM</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> N</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">O</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">. 2)</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;The Board of
Directors recommends that shareholders approve an amendment to Kroger&#8217;s articles
of incorporation requiring a majority vote for the election of
directors.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;Ohio law provides
that, unless otherwise specified in a company&#8217;s articles of incorporation, a
director is elected by a plurality of the votes cast. Kroger&#8217;s articles of
incorporation do not specify the voting standard required in director elections,
so Kroger directors currently are elected by a plurality vote; that is, a
director nominee who receives the highest number of affirmative votes cast is
elected, whether or not those votes constitute a majority including withheld
votes.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;In 2006, Kroger&#8217;s
Board of Directors adopted as Kroger policy a form of majority voting for
uncontested director elections, implementing this policy through its
</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">Guidelines on Issues of Corporate
Governance</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">. Under this
policy, directors continue to be elected by a plurality vote, but the policy
requires that a director nominee who receives a greater number of &#8220;withheld&#8221;
votes than &#8220;for&#8221; votes must immediately tender his or her resignation from the
Board. The Board then would decide, through a process managed by the Corporate
Governance Committee and excluding the nominee in question, whether to accept
the resignation. The Board&#8217;s explanation of its decision would be promptly
disclosed in a publicly issued press release.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;At the annual meeting
of shareholders held in 2009, Kroger&#8217;s shareholders adopted a proposal that
requested the Board of Directors take steps to amend the articles of
incorporation to provide for majority voting for directors in uncontested
elections. After consideration of the shareholder proposal, the Board has
authorized, and recommends that shareholders approve, an amendment to Kroger&#8217;s
articles of incorporation that would specify that director nominees in an
uncontested election would be elected by a majority vote. Under this provision,
each vote is specifically counted &#8220;for&#8221; or &#8220;against&#8221; the director&#8217;s election. An
affirmative majority of the total number of votes cast &#8220;for&#8221; or &#8220;against&#8221; a
director nominee will be required for election. Shareholders also will be
entitled to abstain with respect to the election of a director. Abstentions will
have no effect in determining whether the required affirmative majority vote has
been obtained.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;Under Ohio law,
shareholders must approve an amendment to Kroger&#8217;s articles of incorporation to
change the voting standard in director elections. If the proposed amendment is
approved, a new paragraph will be added as ARTICLE SIXTH of Kroger&#8217;s articles of
incorporation (with succeeding articles renumbered accordingly), that reads as
follows:</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;&#8220;The vote required
for election of a director by the shareholders will, except in a contested
election or when cumulative voting is in effect, be the affirmative vote of a
majority of the votes cast in favor of or against the election of a nominee at a
meeting of shareholders. In a contested election or when cumulative voting is in
effect, directors will be elected by a plurality of the votes cast at a meeting
of shareholders by the holders of shares entitled to vote in the election. An
election will be considered contested if as of the record date there are more
nominees for election than positions on the Board of Directors to be filled by
election at the meeting.&#8221;</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;In addition, we
propose to make minor statutory conforming changes. All changes are shown on
Appendix 1, with additions shown underlined and deletions shown as
strikeouts.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;If approved, this
amendment will become effective upon the filing with the Ohio Secretary of State
of Amended Articles of Incorporation. Kroger would make such a filing promptly
after the annual meeting.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">50</font></font></div>
    </div><br>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font size="3">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>Upon approval of this proposal and
the filing of the Amended Articles of Incorporation, an incumbent director who
does not receive the requisite affirmative majority of the votes cast for his or
her re-election must tender his or her resignation. Under Ohio law, an incumbent
director who is not re-elected may remain in office until his or her successor
is elected and qualified, continuing as a &#8220;holdover&#8221; director until his or her
position is filled. The Board will adopt a holdover director resignation policy
to address the continuation in office of a director that would result from
application of the holdover director provision. Under the holdover director
resignation policy, the Board will decide whether to accept the resignation in a
process similar to the one the Board currently uses pursuant to the existing
policy</font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">T</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">HE</font></font> <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">B</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OARD</font></font> <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OF</font></font> <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">D</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">IRECTORS</font></font> <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">R</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ECOMMENDS</font></font> <font
 style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">A</font></font> <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">V</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OTE</font></font> <font style="TEXT-DECORATION: underline"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">F</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OR</font></font></font> <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">T</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">HIS</font></font> <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">P</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ROPOSAL</font></font><font style
="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">.</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">S</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ELECTION</font></font> <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OF</font></font> <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">A</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">UDITORS</font></font></div>
      <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">(I</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">TEM</font></font> <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">N</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">O</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">. 3)</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;The Audit Committee
of the Board of Directors is responsible for the appointment, compensation and
retention of Kroger&#8217;s independent auditor, as required by law and by applicable
NYSE rules. On March 10, 2010, the Audit Committee appointed
PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as Kroger&#8217;s independent auditor for the fiscal year
ending January 29, 2011. While shareholder ratification of the selection of
PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as Kroger&#8217;s independent auditor is not required by
Kroger&#8217;s Regulations or otherwise, the Board of Directors is submitting the
selection of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP to shareholders for ratification, as it
has in past years, as a good corporate governance practice. If the shareholders
fail to ratify the selection, the Audit Committee may, but is not required to,
reconsider whether to retain that firm. Even if the selection is ratified, the
Audit Committee in its discretion may direct the appointment of a different
auditor at any time during the year if it determines that such a change would be
in the best interests of Kroger and its shareholders.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;A representative of
PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP is expected to be present at the meeting to respond
to appropriate questions and to make a statement if he or she desires to do
so.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">T</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">HE</font></font> <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">B</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OARD</font></font> <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OF</font></font> <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">D</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">IRECTORS</font></font> <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">R</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ECOMMENDS</font></font> <font
 style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">A</font></font> <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">V</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OTE</font></font> <font style="TEXT-DECORATION: underline"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">F</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OR</font></font></font> <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">T</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">HIS</font></font> <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">P</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ROPOSAL</font></font><font style
="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">.</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">D</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ISCLOSURE</font></font> <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OF</font></font> <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">A</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">UDITOR</font></font> <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">F</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">EES</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>

describes the fees billed to Kroger by PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP related to the
fiscal years ended January 30, 2010 and January 31, 2009:</font></div>

      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;Audit

January 30, 2010 and January 31, 2009, respectively, were for professional
services rendered for the audits of Kroger&#8217;s consolidated financial statements,
the issuance of comfort letters to underwriters, consents, income tax provision
procedures, and assistance with the review of documents filed with the
SEC.</font></div>

    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br><a name="page_6"><!--EFPlaceholder-->
</a>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;Audit-Related
Fees</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> for the years ended
January 30, 2010 and January 31, 2009, respectively, were for assurance and
related services pertaining to accounting consultation in connection with
acquisitions, attest services that are not required by statute or regulation,
and consultations concerning financial accounting and reporting
standards.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;Tax
Fees.</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> We did not engage
PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP for other tax services for the years ended January
30, 2010 and January 31, 2009.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;All Other
Fees.</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> We did not engage
PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP for other services for the years ended January 30,
2010 and January 31, 2009.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;The Audit Committee
requires that it approve in advance all audit and non-audit work performed by
PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP. On March 10, 2010, the Audit Committee approved
services to be performed by PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP for the remainder of
fiscal year 2010 that are related to the audit of Kroger or involve the audit
itself. In 2007, the Audit Committee adopted an audit and non-audit service
pre-approval policy. Pursuant to the terms of that policy, the Committee will
annually pre-approve certain defined services that are expected to be provided
by the independent auditors. If it becomes appropriate during the year to engage
the independent accountant for additional services, the Audit Committee must
first approve the specific services before the independent accountant may
perform the additional work.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;PricewaterhouseCoopers
LLP has advised the Audit Committee that neither the firm, nor any member of the
firm, has any financial interest, direct or indirect, in any capacity in Kroger
or its subsidiaries.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">S</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">HAREHOLDER</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> P</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ROPOSAL</font></font></div>
      <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">(I</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">TEM</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> N</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">O</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">. 4)</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;We have been notified
by a shareholder, the name and shareholdings of which will be furnished promptly
to any shareholder upon written or oral request to Kroger&#8217;s Secretary at
Kroger&#8217;s executive offices, that it intends to propose the following resolution
at the annual meeting:</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">S</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">HAREHOLDER</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> R</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ESOLUTION</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;WHEREAS, in 2007, the
Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change&#8217;s (IPCC) Fourth Assessment Report
states it is &#8220;very likely&#8221; that anthropogenic greenhouse gas emissions have
heavily contributed to global warming. Furthermore, &#8220;Impacts of climate change
will vary regionally but, aggregated and discounted to the present, they are
very likely to impose net annual costs which will increase over time as global
temperatures increase.&#8221;</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;WHEREAS, in 2008, the
United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) reported that, &#8220;No matter the
region, weather and climate factors such as temperature, precipitation, CO<font style="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: sub">2</font> concentrations, and
</font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">water availability directly
impact the health and well-being of plants, pasture, rangeland, and livestock.&#8221;
Specifically, &#8220;Climate change affects average temperatures and temperature
extremes; timing and geographical patterns of precipitation; snowmelt, runoff,
evaporation, and soil moisture; the frequency of disturbances, such as drought,
insect and disease outbreaks, severe storms, and forest fires; atmospheric
composition and air quality; and patterns of human settlement and land use
change,&#8221; which directly impact crop yields and meat production.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;WHEREAS, in 2008,
Acclimatise, a risk management firm, reported that climate-related &#8220;impacts will
be felt throughout a company&#8217;s business model, with consequences for its raw
materials, supply chains, essential utilities, assets and operations, markets,
customers and products, its workforce and the communities in which it is
located.&#8221;</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">52</font></font></div>
    </div><br>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br><a name="page_7"><!--EFPlaceholder-->
</a>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;WHEREAS, increasingly
investors believe that there is an intersection between climate change and
corporate financial performance. Goldman Sachs reported in May, 2009, &#8220;We find
that while many companies acknowledge the challenges climate change presents &#8230;
there are significant differences in the extent to which companies are taking
action. Differences in the effectiveness of response across industries create
opportunities to lose or establish competitive advantage, which we believe will
prove increasingly important to investment performance.&#8221;</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;WHEREAS, a 2008
report by Ceres and RiskMetrics ranked Kroger&#8217;s corporate climate change
governance in the bottom-half of an industry peer group and the bottom third of
all companies analyzed, representing 63 of the world&#8217;s largest retail,
pharmaceutical, technology, apparel and other consumer-facing
companies.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;WHEREAS, the Carbon
Disclosure Project (CDP), representing 475 institutional investors with assets
of more than $55 trillion under management, requested 3,700 corporations to
disclose their climate-related risks in February, 2009. Kroger currently does
not publicly respond to the CDP questionnaire.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;WHEREAS, leading
companies in the food retailing industry, such Tesco, Wal-Mart, and Sainsbury&#8217;s,
publicly report on risks, including implications to their product and
manufacturing supply chain, from climate change.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;WHEREAS, information
from corporations on their climate change risks and strategies is essential to
investors as they assess the strengths of corporate securities in the context of
climate change.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;RESOLVED:
Shareholders request that within 6 months of the 2010 annual meeting, the Board
of Directors provide a report to shareholders, prepared at reasonable cost and
omitting proprietary information, describing how Kroger will assess and manage
the impacts of climate change on the corporation, with specific regard to its
supply chain, and plans to disclose such information through public reporting
mechanisms.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">T</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">HE</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> B</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OARD</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OF</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> D</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">IRECTORS</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> R</font></font><font style="DI
SPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ECOMMENDS</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">A</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> V</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OTE</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> <font style="TEXT-DECORATION: underline">A</font></font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; TEXT-DECORATION: underline"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">GAINST</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> T</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">HIS</
font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> P</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">ROPOSAL</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">FOR</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> </font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">THE</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> F</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">OLLOWING</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> R</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WE
IGHT: bold"><font size="1" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">EASONS</font></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">:</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;Kroger recognizes the
important role it plays as a good steward of the environment. We have numerous
&#8220;green&#8221; initiatives in place to save energy and preserve our natural resources.
For each of the past several years Kroger has published on-line </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">The Kroger Co. Public Responsibilities Report </font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">and</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> Doing Our Part &#8211; The Kroger Co.&#8217;s Green Report</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"> that highlight the company&#8217;s &#8220;green&#8221;
initiatives in greater detail.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;This proposal is
similar to one submitted by a shareholder in each of the annual meetings held in
2007 and 2008. Those proposals were defeated by shareholders.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;This proposal
requests assessment of climate change and furnishing a report to shareholders.
We believe such a report in many ways would be duplicative of the current
efforts underway, and would provide little benefit to shareholders beyond what
Kroger already has furnished. We believe it would be a waste of time, resources,
and money for Kroger and our shareholders.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;We have developed our
own form of reporting that we believe provides beneficial and cost effective
disclosure to our shareholders on the environmental issues that are relevant to
our business operations. These reports are published on the Kroger
website.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">53</font></font></div>
    </div><br>
    <hr align="center" noshade size="2" width="100%">
    <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">
    </div><br><a name="page_8"><!--EFPlaceholder-->
</a>
    <div style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 20pt; BORDER-TOP: black 1pt solid; PADDING-LEFT: 20pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 5pt; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-TOP: 30pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid">
      <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font size="2"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">__________________</font></font><font size="2"><br>&#160;</font></div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;SHAREHOLDER PROPOSALS
&#8211; 2011 ANNUAL MEETING. Shareholder proposals intended for inclusion in our proxy
material relating to Kroger&#8217;s annual meeting in June 2011 should be addressed to
the Secretary of Kroger and must be received at our executive offices not later
than January 14, 2011. These proposals must comply with the proxy rules
established by the SEC. In addition, the proxy solicited by the Board of
Directors for the 2011 annual meeting of shareholders will confer discretionary
authority to vote on any shareholder proposal presented at the meeting unless we
are provided with notice of the proposal on or before March 31, 2011. Please
note, however, that Kroger&#8217;s Regulations require a minimum of 45 days&#8217; advance
notice to Kroger in order for a matter to be brought before shareholders at the
annual meeting. As a result, any attempt to present a proposal without notifying
Kroger on or before March 31, 2011, will be ruled out of order and will not be
permitted.</font></div>
      <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2">__________________</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;Attached to this
Proxy Statement is Kroger&#8217;s 2009 Annual Report which includes a brief
description of Kroger&#8217;s business, including the general scope and nature thereof
during 2009, together with the audited financial information contained in our
2009 report to the SEC on Form 10-K. </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">A copy of that report is available to shareholders on request by writing
to: Scott M. Henderson, Treasurer, The Kroger Co., 1014 Vine Street, Cincinnati,
Ohio 45202-1100 or by calling 1-513-762-1220</font></font><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">. Our SEC filings are available to the public
from the SEC&#8217;s web site at www.sec.gov.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="justify"><font size="2" style="FONT-FAMILY: serif"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 3pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;The management knows
of no other matters that are to be presented at the meeting but, if any should
be presented, the Proxy Committee expects to vote thereon according to its best
judgment.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right">

      <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: serif">54</font></font></div>
